He owns the home where he lives with his family and he also supports his sister, sending her money to help with household expenses.  He has a military pension and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials (nails, beams, blocks, cement, sand, iron, etc.) to continue construction on his home.  In the future he plans to begin raising broiler chickens, and to finish his home.  For this reason, he plans to make his payments on schedule so he can request additional loans from Hluvuku.  The challenge he faces is a lack of funds to start his own business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (nails, beams, blocks, cement, sand, iron, etc.) to continue construction on his home.

loans.name: Valente

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É formador de professores numa Escola de formação de professores e tem um negocio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (massas, arroz, açúcar, refrescos, vinhos, feijão e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de mercadoria no seu estabelecimento. 
No futuro deseja construir um estabelecimento comercial próprio porque actualmente usa do seu sobrinho, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a educação dos filhos dado ao elevado custo de propinas.
texts.en: Valente is married and has 4 children who attend school.  He owns the home where he lives with his family and he does not support anyone else.  He trains teachers at a teacher education school and he also has a business selling basic goods.  With this loan he plans to purchase products (dough, rice, sugar, wine, beans, etc.) to increase the stock of merchandise in his store.  In the future he wants to construct his own store becaue he currently uses his nephew's shop.  For this reason he plans to make his payments as scheduled in order to request additional loans form Hluvuku.  The challenge he faces is providing an education for his children given the high cost of required payments.

loans.use: to buy products for resale (dough, rice, sugar, soft drinks, wine, beans, etc.)

loans.name: Felix

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filho ainda menor de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Trabalha como motorista numa empresa privada. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com o melhoramento da sua casa.
No futuro pretende abrir um restaurante e casar oficialmente, assim compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar ainda mais para poder realizar mais empréstimos de forma a alcançar os seus projectos.
texts.en: Felix is married and has 1 young son.  He owns the home where he lives with his family and he does not support anyone else.  He works as a driver for a private company.  With this loan he plans to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stones, iron, etc.) to continue making improvements on his home.  In the future he plans to open a restaurant and to officially get married.  He promises to make his payments as scheduled in order to request additional loans from Hluvuku.  The challenge he faces is to work even more in order to obtain future loans as a means to complete his projects.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stones, iron, etc) to continue making improvements to his home.

loans.name: Moises

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 8 filhos e 2 dos quais frequentam a Escola os restantes já tem suas próprias famílias, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem dos 2 filhos. 	
Trabalha como segurança numa empresa privada e possui um negócio próprio. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (cadeiras e mesas plásticas, mantas, camas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de mercadoria e posterior revenda. 
No futuro gostaria de construir um aviário e um estabelecimento comercial no seu quintal, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a procurar formas de aumentar a sua receita.
texts.en: Moises is married and has 8 children, 2 of whom attend school.  The rest already have their own families.  He owns the home where he lives and does not support anyone else besides the two children at home.  He works as a security guard in a private company and also has his own business.  With this loan he plans to purchase products (plastic tables and chairs, blankets, beds, etc.) to increase his stock of merchandise for later resale.   In the future he would like to construct an aviary and a commercial locale on his farm.  For that reason he promises to make his loan payments as scheduled so he can request additional loans from Hluvuku.  The challenge he faces is finding ways to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase products for sale (plastic chairs and tables, blankets, beds, etc.)

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos, dois dos quais já frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É operário agrícola já há bastante tempo. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes, blocos, cimento, areia, ferro e outros) para iniciar uma outra obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende terminar a sua formação e concluir a sua residência, assim compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar a dobrar para poder cobrir os projectos com os rendimentos obtidos.
texts.en: Lazaro is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom already attend school.  He owns the home where he lives with this family and does not support anyone else.  He has been an agricultural worker for a long time.  With this loan he plans to purchase construction materials (beams, blocks, cement, sand, iron, etc.) to start another construction project on his home.  In the future he plans to complete his education and finish his home, so he promises to make his loan payments on schedule in order to request more loans from Hluvuku.  The challenge he faces is to work double in order to complete these projects with his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (beams, blocks, cement, sand, iron, etc.) to start another construction project on his home.

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe que vive com ele. 	
Trabalha como serralheiro e comerciante. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, açúcar, farinha, óleo, cervejas, vinho e outros) para poder aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria e responder a demanda da sua clientela. 
No futuro gostaria de se tornar um grande revendedor na zona, esta confiante nisso porque possui um contentor em sua casa, assim compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir fundos que possam responder as suas necessidades.
texts.en: Joao is married and has 2 adult children.  He owns the home where he lives with his family and he also supports his mother, who lives with him.  He is a metalworker and also has a store.  With this loan he plans to purchase products (rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, beer, wine, etc.) in order to increase his inventory and meet his customers' needs.   In the future he would like to become a large reseller in his area.  He is confident he can do this because he has a storage container in his home.  He promises to make his payments as scheduled in order to request additional loans from Hluvuku.  The challenge he faces is to obtain sufficient funds to meet his needs.

loans.use: to buy products for sale (rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, beer, wine, etc.)

loans.name: Elina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos, dos quais 1 frequenta a Escola e outros ainda menores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É policial e quadro do Ministério do Interior. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (tintas, pincéis, rolos de pintar, mão de obra e outros) para continuar com os acabamentos da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja continuar com os seus estudos ampliar a casa e construir um muro de vedação, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é iniciar uma actividade comercial para incrementar a renda para poder responder os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Elina is married and has 3 children, 1 of whom attends school.  The others are still too young.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and does not support anyone else.  

She is a police officer with the Ministry of the Interior.  With this loan she plans to purchase construction materials (paint, brushes, paint rollers, labor, etc.) to continue the finish work on her home. In the future she wants to continue her education, add on to her home, and construct a wall. For this reason she promises to make her payments on schedule to be able to request additional loans from Hluvuku.

Her greatest challenge is to be able to start a small business to increase income and complete her projects.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (paint, brushes, paint rollers, labor, etc.) to continue the finish work on her home.

loans.name: Constantino

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos já maiores de idade não vão a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus enteados que vivem com ele. 	
É militar e trabalha como segurança. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (material eléctrico, mão de obra e outros) para poder continuar com o melhoramento da sua casa. 
No futuro pretende continuar a melhorar a sua casa para garantir conforto a sua família, assim compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir liquidar o empréstimo para solicitar outro o mais rápido possível.
texts.en: Constantino is married and has 3 adult children who are not in school.  He owns the home where he lives with his family and he also supports his stepchildren, who live with him.  Constantino is in the military and works as a security guard.  With this loan he plans to purchase construction materials (electrical supplies, labor, etc.) to continue making improvements to his home.  In the future he plans to continue making improvements to his home to guarantee comfort for his family.  He promises to make his loan payments as scheduled in order to request additional loans from Hluvuku.  The challenge he faces is paying off his loan in order to request another one as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (electrical supplies, labor, etc.) to continue making improvements to his home.

loans.name: Mariana Azucena

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 12 años que estudian dos en universidad y  dos en colegio. El marido es comerciante de frutas y verduras.

Ella para ayudar a su marido el cual no gana lo suficiente para mantener el hogar se dedica  a preparar hayacas (plato típico del campo manabita que es muy apreciado por las personas de otras ciudades), todos los días ella prepara las hayacas y luego manda a entregar con su esposo a la ciudad de Manta al mismo tiempo que el realiza sus ventas de verduras y frutas. Lleva más de 20 años y  fue su suegra que le dejo este negocio cuando falleció ya que ella  se dedicaba a este negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar los víveres necesarios para preparar estos productos. Lleva más de 6 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les da el banco. 

Su sueño es gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the “Desarrollo Femenino” communal bank meet every two weeks in the Calderón parish of the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its delicious food and for its vegetation.  Most of its residents are involved in farming and general business.

Mariana lives here.  She’s 46 years old, is in a live-in relationship and has four children between the ages of 17 and 12.  Two of them study at the university and the other two attend school.  Her husband sells fruits and vegetables.

In order to help her husband, who doesn’t earn enough to support the household; she prepares hayacas (a typical manabita country dish that is enjoyed by people in other towns).  Each day she prepares hayacas and her husband delivers them in the city of Manta, while he sells his fruits and vegetables.  She has been doing this for more than 20 years and it was her mother in law who left her this business when she passed away.
 
She will use the money from this loan to buy the necessary ingredients to make her products.  She has been with the communal bank for more than six years and she likes the assistance that the bank provides.

Her dream is to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Mercedes Maribel

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación,  la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  17, 14 y 9 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en  escuela. Su esposo es mecánico industrial.

Ella realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo el cual tiene un taller mecánico donde realizan diversos trabajos como construcción de carrocerías para todo tipo de carros, también trabajan  con carrocerías y pintura de autobuses,  para realizar estos trabajos ellos tiene que contratar hasta dos o tres operarios a los cuales tiene que darles el almuerzo. Su esposo lleva más de 21 años dedicado a esta actividad. 

Este crédito es para comprar pintura, hierro, suelda y otros materiales necesarios para realizar sus trabajos. Lleva 10 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ayudar a su esposo en su trabajo. 

Sus sueños seguir adelante y que no les falte trabajo.
texts.en:
The members of the “Desarrollo Femenino” communal bank meet every two weeks in the Calderón parish of the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its delicious food and for its vegetation.  Most of its residents are involved in farming and general business.

Mercedes lives here.  She is 44 years old, married, and has three children, ages 17, 14, and 9.  The two oldest attend high school and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband is a commercial mechanic.

She is asking for this loan so that she can help her husband who has a mechanics workshop where he does different things, such as building bodies for all types of cars.  He also works with bus bodies and painting.  In order to do this, he needs to hire two or three helpers to whom he must also provide lunch.  Her husband has been doing this for more than 21 years.

This loan will be used to buy paint, iron, solder, and other supplies needed to do his work.  She has been with the communal bank for 10 years and she likes it because the loans have allowed her to help her husband with his work.

Her dreams are to continue moving ahead and that there be no shortage of work.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Marlene Katiuska

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación,  la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Marlene tiene, 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 3 años la mayor y una bebé de tres meses de nacida. El marido trabaja en un bus de transporte. 

Ella con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar con los gastos de sus pequeños hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogos y productos de Avon, y Lebel (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos porque su mamá le ayuda cuidándoles de sus pequeños hijos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta o en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más 3 años en su negocio y le ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa,  perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
In the Calderón parish of the city of Portoviejo, every fifteen days the members of the Desarrollo Femenino communal bank meet. This place is known for its rich gastronomy and its vegetation. The majority of its inhabitants make a living through agriculture and trade in general.

Here lives Marlene. She is 21 years old and has a common-law relationship, from which she has two children, the older three years old and a three-month-old baby. Her husband works on a transport bus.

In order to have her own income and thereby help with the costs of her small children, she sells clothing through catalogs and Avon products, and Lebel (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for ladies). She works three days a week, mostly in the morning since at that time it is easier for her to complete her route because her mother helps her by taking care of her small children. Her manner of selling is door to door or from her home where her customers arrive, leave on credit, and pay every eight days. She has worked in her business for more than three years and it has gone well for her.

She will use this loan to buy clothing, perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and other products. She has been a part of the communal bank for three years and she likes it because thanks to her first loan she began her business.
Her dream is to give the best to her small children.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, jewelery, cosmetics, creams, etc.

loans.name: Marcia Leticia

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Marcia, tiene 53 años de edad, está separada pero de esta  relación tuvo un hijo el mismo que ya es mayor de edad e independiente. Ella está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de pagos del grupo y le gusta porque el grupo es muy cumplido y esto es muy bueno para todos.

Doña Marcia es una mujer  muy trabajadora que siempre le gusto ganar su propio dinero, hace mas de 20 años como pudo empezó un negocio de bazar en su casa, donde vende ropa, carteras, zapatos productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y todo tipo de regalos o arreglos de casa,  trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y si alguien necesita de algo hasta más tarde, trabaja sola y le gusta su negocio el mismo que le permitió sacar adelante a su hijo. Ella en su negocio se entretiene y se gana su sustento.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, carteras, zapatos, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y todo de lo que ella vende en su bazar. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante mejorando cada dia su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the “Desarrollo Femenino” communal bank meet every two weeks in the Calderón parish of the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its delicious food and for its vegetation.  Most of its residents are involved in farming and general business.

Marcia lives here.  She’s 53 years old, is separated, but has a son.  He’s now an adult and on his own.  She’s been with the communal bank since it began and is in charge of payments for the group.  She likes it because the group meets its responsibilities and this is good for everyone.

Marcia is a hardworking woman who always liked earning her own money.  She started a store out of her home more than 20 years ago, where she sells clothing, wallets, shoes, Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories), and all types of accessories for the home.  She works daily from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm and later if she needs to.  She works on her own and she likes the business because it helps her help her son get ahead.  She enjoys her business and it earns her a living.
 
She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing, wallets, shoes, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and all of the thing she sells.

Her dream is to continue moving ahead and improving her business each day.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Blanca Tulmira

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Blanca, tiene 52 años de edad, está separada pero de esta  relación tuvo cinco  hijos todos mayores de edad,  dos de ellos aun vive con ella.
 
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto solventar los gastos del hogar, hace 12 años atrás empezó un negocio de venta de encebollados (plato típico), los fines de semana arrela un pequeño local en su domicilio en el cual vende este delicioso plato que es de mucho agrado de las personas, también sus hijos llevan a vender este plato en un triciclo a un lugar muy concurrido de la localidad.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado,  yuca, sodas y varios víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
  
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
In the Calderon parish in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the communal bank Desarollo Femenino meet every fifteen days.  This area is known for its rich gastronomy and vegetation, and most of the inhabitants work in agricultural or sales.

It is home to Blanca, 52 years old, who is separated with five adult children, two of whom still live with her.

Blanca is a hardworking woman who, in order to provide for herself and cover household expenses, began a business selling encebollados (a typical dish) twelve years ago.  On the weekends she sets up a small shop in her home where she sells this delicious dish that many people appreciate.  Her children also deliver the dish on a tricycle to a busy area of the neighborhood.

This loan is to buy fish, yucca, sodas and other ingredients necessary to prepare the meals.  She has been with the communal bank since it’s beginning, and is happy because she was able to start her business with one of the loans provided.

Her dream is to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: buy fish, yucca, soda, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente Juan no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica que desea, pero sueña con poder hacerlo muy pronto, en sus ratos libres busca pequeños empleos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su familia, Juan trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, él cuenta con una mototaxi propia, la cual es su herramienta principal de trabajo, todas los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, Juan puede trabajar un promedio de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una mototaxi, a fin de utilizarla para ampliar su negocio; de esta manera Juan seguirá trabajando y espera aumentar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un fututo no muy lejano pueda cumplir su gran sueño de ser un buen profesional y tener su negocio propio.
texts.en:
Juan is 21 years old, he is single and lives in the city of Ica. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who is very keen to get ahead. Unfortunately Juan was not able to study a career in mechanical engineering as he had hoped, but he dreams of being able to do so very soon. In his free time, he seeks out small jobs, and sometimes cooks a delicious dish of Carapulcra con sopa seca to share with his family. 

With a lot of hard work, enthusiasm, and thanks to the support of his family, Juan works as a motorcycle taxi driver. He has his own motorcycle taxi which is his main business tool. Juan starts his work in the early hours of the morning every day, going around the streets of the city searching for passengers. On average, Juan can work 12 hours a day, and he thinks that it is going well thanks to his dedication and the friendly treatment he offers his customers.

Juan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help that has been given he will be able to buy a motorcycle taxi in order to expand his business. In this way, Juan can continue working and he hopes to increase his financial income, which will be very useful to him so that in the not-so-distant future he can fulfill his dream of being a good professional and have his own business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Zoila Isabel

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 63 años de edad, hace varios años su  esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvieron dos  hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Ella en la actualidad vive en la casa de la mamá la cual está muy anciana.

Doña Zoila para salir adelante se dedica al comercio con su hija,  venden ropa pero su hija es la que administran más mas el negocio porque la señora Zoila tiene que hacerse cargo de los cuidados de su mamá, llevan más de tres años con la venta de ropa y  gracias a Dios se vende bastante mercadería, la misma que la compran en Guayaquil cada vez que necesitan,  este negocio lo empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del banco y poco a poco lo ha ido aumentando con los créditos posteriores.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, camisas, entre otras prendas de vestir. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la secretaria del banco y le gusta porque en el banco le han dado mucho apoyo para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Desarrollo Femenino community bank meet in Calderón parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This city is known for its delicious cuisine and its vegetation.  Most of the locals work in farming and general commerce.

This is where Zoila lives.  Zoila is 63 years old.  Her husband passed away several years ago but she has two children from her relationship who are adults and live independently.  Zoila currently lives in her mom's house.  Her mom is very elderly.

In order to provide for herself, Zoila works in commerce together with her daughter.  They sell clothing but Zoila's daughter is the one who is most in charge of the business because Zoila has to take care of her mom.  They have been selling clothing for more than three years and, thanks to God, they sell quite a lot of merchandise which they buy in Guayaquil whenever they need to.  Zoila started this business with one of the loans that she received from her community bank and she has gradually expanded the business with subsequent loans.

Zoila will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, shirts and other items of clothing.  She is a founding member of her community bank and its secretary.  She likes being a member of the bank because she has received a lot of support from it.  Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, shirts and other items of clothing

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna, de 57 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre y amable. Está casada con Juan ya hace varios años quien es obrero y padre de sus 4 hijos.  Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y un nieto a quien cría y desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Reyna es el de realizar costura, tiene una taller pequeño pero muy bien instalado en su casa, ahí hace trabajos por encargo o cuando no tiene ningún encargo hace sus propios diseños y creaciones para poder vender a sus clientes que siempre van en busca de un nuevo modelo y diseño para comprar. Lleva haciendo este trabajo desde muy joven, siempre tuvo curiosidad  y  su madre le enseñó todo lo que sabe y desde ahí decidió trabajar en ésta actividad, y hasta el momento lo realiza  sola. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
A ella le gusta todo de su trabajo, siempre está alegre ya que gana dinero haciendo lo que le gusta, además que siempre tiene clientes, espera poder seguir así con su trabajo. Este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, por tanto cuenta con su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado 1800 soles, comprará materiales para continuar con su trabajo como telas, hilos, elásticos, entre otros, además comprará una maquina de coser valorizado en 350 nuevos soles ya que desea implementarse para tener un mejor acabado en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Reyna, age 57, is a cheerful and friendly woman. For several years she has been married to Juan, who works as a laborer and is the father of their four children. Reyna and her husband live in their own home along with a grandson, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. She works as a seamstress and has a small, but functional workshop that is located in her house. Reyna’s work is done from orders, but whenever she has few orders, she works on her own designs and creations that she sells to her customers who are always looking to buy something new. She has been working ever since she was a young woman. Reyna has always been curious, so her mother taught her everything she knows. She eventually decided to work as a seamstress and now manages her business by herself. Reyna considers her business to be profitable since it generate a good revenue stream.

She likes everything about her work, but she is always happy to be earning a living by doing something that she enjoys. Reyna has many customers, so she hopes to continue working. This will be her eighth loan with MFP, so she is pleased to be in this partnership in order to continue pursuing her goals. With the amount of 1,800 PEN that she requested, Reyna will buy materials needed to continue her work such as fabrics, thread, elastics, and other items. She will also purchase a sewing machine valued at 350 PEN so that she can do a better job with the finishing touches on her work.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabrics, thread, elastics, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Ercilia

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 65 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 años y le gusta porque con los  créditos ella ha surtido aun más su tienda.

Doña Rosa para salir adelante sola y sin depender de nadie hace 12 años atrás empezó un negocio en su casa, como pudo surtió un pequeña tienda la cual con el paso del tiempo y con la ayuda de los créditos ah mejorado mucho y  le a  permitido salir adelante, allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas y ciertas cosa de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus nietos a veces llegan a  ayudarle ya que sus hijos viven cerca de su casa.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y otros productos que vende en su local.

Sus sueños  son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener salud ante todo.
texts.en:
The members of the “Desarrollo Femenino” communal bank meet every two weeks in the Calderón parish of the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its delicious food and for its vegetation.  Most of its residents are involved in farming and general business.

Rosa lives here.  She’s 65 years old and is the single mother of two adult children, both on their own.  She has been with the communal bank for six years and she likes it because the loans have helped her stock her store more.
 
In order to get ahead and not have to depend on anyone else, Rosa started her business out of her home 12 years ago.  She stocked her small store as best she could and has improved it over time with the help of the loans.  This has helped her to get ahead.  She sells all types of products such as sugar, cooking oils, detergents, fruits and vegetables, and various types of paper goods.  She works daily from 6:00am to 8:00pm and sometimes later.  Her grandchildren sometimes help her, since her children live nearby. 
 
She will use the money from this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, and other products that she sells.

Her dreams are to continue ahead with her business and above all to be healthy.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Carmen Cerela

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación,  la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen ella tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos , dos mayores  de edad y tres de 11, 10 y 8 años de edad, los tres menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo  el cual tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, él muy de madrugada se va a la ciudad de Portoviejo para abastecerse de todos los productos que venden en el mercado mayorista en esta ciudad  para luego trasladarse al mercado de su localidad y poder vender sus productos a las personas que a diario acuden a este lugar a comprar los alimentos, trabaja todos los días y realiza esta actividad desde que tenía 9 años y es así como él se gana el sustento diario de toda la familia.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres para su negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda el Banco.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres en su casa.
texts.en:
The members of the “Desarrollo Femenino” communal bank meet every two weeks in the Calderón parish of the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its delicious food and for its vegetation.  Most of its residents are involved in farming and general business.

Carmen lives here.  She’s 43 years old, is in a live in relationship and has five children.  Two of them are adults and the others are ages 11, 10, and 8.  The three youngest attend school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a great housewife who is asking for this loan in order to help her husband, who has a fruits and vegetables business.  Very early in the morning he goes to Portoviejo to supply himself with all of the products that they sell in the main marketplace, so that he can later sell them at the local marketplace, where people go to buy their daily food.  He works every day and has been doing this for nine years.  This is how he supports his family each day.
 
This loan is so that he can buy vegetables for his business.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes the benefits that the bank provides. 

Her dream is to have a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: María Ana Bella

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación,  la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto al esposo  para salir adelante tienen una tienda en su casa,  allí venden todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, trabajan en este lugar de lunes a viernes ya que los fines de semana ponen un local en el mercado de este lugar y así aprovechan para vender más, ya en estos dos días son las ferias en este lugar y muchas personas salen de los campos a abastecerse de productos. Tienen más de 25 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 11 años y le gusta porque los  créditos les ayudan mucho. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the Calderon parish in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the communal bank Desarollo Femenino meet every fifteen days.  This area is known for its rich gastronomy and vegetation, and most of the inhabitants work in agriculture or sales.

It is home to Ana, 53 years old, who is married with five adult children, three of whom still live at home.  Her husband is a salesman.

Ana and her husband, working together to move forward, run a shop out of their home.  There they sell all kinds of products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, fruit and vegetables.  They work Monday through Friday and on weekends they have a stand at the market where they can sell even more.  On these two days, many people come from the farms to stock up on products.

Ana has worked in this business for over 25 years and it is going well.  She will use this loan to stock her store with a variety of products.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other basic products.  She has been a part of the communal bank for over 11 years and she likes it because the loans help her a lot.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other basic products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a batch of paper products

loans.name: María Elza

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación,  la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 71 años de edad, es madre soltera de siete hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que para salir adelante sola se dedica a preparar y vender salchichas, tiene un restauran en su casa en el cual vende sus deliciosos alimentos como caldo de salchicha acompañando de un buen plátano asado y las salchichas asadas, estos platos  son muy apetecidos por sus clientes. Ella lleva más de 25 años con este negocio el cual le ha permitido salir adelante y tener mucha clientela que saben lo delicioso que ella prepara estos alimentos.  Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su hijo.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, tripas de chancho y varios víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque en todo este tiempo le han ayudado mucho.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Desarrollo Femenino community bank meet in the parish of Calderón, in the city of Portoviejo. This city is known for its delicious cuisine and its vegetation.  Most of the local people work in farming and general commerce.

This is where María lives.  María is 71 years old and the single mother of seven children who are all adults.  One of them still lives with her at home.

María is a very tenacious woman who prepares and sells sausages in order to provide for herself.  She has a restaurant in her house where she sells  delicious food such as sausage stew, roasted yellow plantain and barbecued sausages.  These dishes are very much appreciated by her customers.  María has been in this business for more than 25 years and it has allowed her to make progress and gain a lot of customers who know just how delicious her dishes are.  She works every day with the help of her son.

María will use this loan to buy rice, pig intestines and various supplies that she needs for preparing her food.  She has been a member of her community bank from the beginning and she enjoys being a member because it has helped her a lot over the years.  Her dreams are to make progress in her business and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy rice, pig intestines and other supplies

loans.name: Itishree Self Help Group

texts.en:
The responsible Itishree Self Help Group is made up of 11 members. The members of Itishree Self Help Group are all women from the district of Khurda in Odisha, India. One of them is Ms.Sanju, who was selected as their president. The lady sitting second from the right hand side, wearing a red and white saree, is Sanju.

Sanju is a 45-year-old woman living with her husband and four children. She makes leaf plates and bowls woven out of dry leaves and sells them in the nearby market. These plates are used for different purposes – mainly for serving food. She makes different types and sizes of plates depending upon the demand of her customers. She has requested a loan to purchase machinery so she can weave the plates more frequently and quickly and also to purchase raw materials like leaves, thread, glue and plastic. She has a very good relationship with her customers because she completes their orders on time.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing raw materials like dry leaves, thread, glue and plastic and a machine for weaving leaf plates.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Doña Rosa Emilia de 48 años de edad, licenciada en contabilidad, tienen un hijo de 13 años de edad, anteriormente había pasado 6 meses sin empleo y tuvo que dedicarse a la crianza de gallinas de esa manera logro superarse ahora trabaja en un restaurante hace 4 años aunque con un salario muy bajo. Es por eso que solicita crédito para hacer un cuarto en su casa de habitación por lo que necesita comprar: arena, cemento, piedrines, zinc, perlines y clavos. Ya que su prioridad es dejarle una buena educación, un techo digno a su único hijo en un futuro muy cercano.
texts.en: Emilia is 48 years old, has formal education in accounting, and has a 13 year old son.  Previously she’d been unemployed for six months and had to start raising chickens and was able to get ahead this way.  Now she’s been working at a restaurant for four months, although the pay is low.  It’s for this reason that she’s requesting this loan.  She wants to add a room to her house and needs to buy sand, cement, stone, zinc sheeting, rebar, and nails.  Her priority is to provide her son with a good roof over his head in the near future.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación,  la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es empleado público.

Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad y hoy con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí  se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa y vende ropa por catalogo de la marca leonisa. También prepara dulces y tortas pero solo bajo pedidos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar ya sea de costura o de los dulces que tiene muchos pedidos, ella tiene más de 35 años con su labor de costura.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, materiales para la costura y víveres para preparar los dulces. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le  brinda el Banco. 

Su sueño es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
The members of the “Desarrollo Femenino” communal bank meet every two weeks in the Calderón parish of the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its delicious food and for its vegetation.  Most of its residents are involved in farming and general business.

María lives here.  She is 58 years old, is married and has five adult children, all on their own.  Her husband is a public employee.
 
A few years ago she learned to sew at a local school and she set up a small workshop in her home so that she could earn her own money by taking advantage of her knowledge of sewing.  There she makes all types of clothing and also does catalog sales of Leonisa brand clothing.  She also makes sandwiches and candy, but only to order.  She works daily from 6:00am to 8:00pm and sometimes later if she has orders to fill, either sewing, or candy.  She has been sewing for more than 35 years.
 
She will use the money from this new loan to buy fabrics and sewing supplies, as well as ingredients for her candies.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes the assistance that the bank provides.

Her dream is to have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Don Rafael de 40 años de edad, siempre trabajando en conjunto con su esposa, sus 3 hijos todavía van a la escuela, se dedica de lleno a la agricultura y su esposa es quien le ayuda a vender los frutos de la cosecha, don Rafael tuvo dificultades en un tiempo con los insumos para sus cultivos pero gracias al financiamiento de AFODENIC y KIVA ha podido sacarlo adelante; es por eso que solicita nuevamente el crédito para darle mantenimiento a 2 manzanas de pitahaya para comprar insumos como: abono, insecticidas y fungicidas, don Rafael en un futuro piensa comprar más tierra para seguir incrementando su capital con mayores cultivos.
texts.en: Rafael is 40 years old and works together with his wife.  Their three children are still attending school.  Rafael works as a full-time farmer and his wife helps him to sell the fruits of his harvests.  Rafael experienced difficulties for a while in obtaining supplies for his crops but, thanks to a loan from Afodenic and Kiva, he has been able to make progress.  He is requesting a new loan to maintain two 'manzanas' (just under 3.5 acres) of 'pitahaya' (dragon fruit).  He will buy supplies such as fertilizers, insecticides and fungicides.  In the future, Rafael plans to buy more land so that he can continue increasing his capital by growing more crops.

loans.use: to buy fungicides, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Doña María, sigue trabajando, como cocinera en un cafetín que es de su hermana, apoyándose mutuamente.  Sus tres hijos casados, contando con el apoyo moral y económico de su esposo, el cual labora como cadete de taxi siendo el propietario, obteniendo mejor porcentaje de ganancia, aunque los costos de la gasolina están elevados.
Como objetivo ha sido la remodelación de su vivienda, el cual ha venido logrando hacer a corto plazo con los préstamos otorgados en Afodenic, y ahorros. Ha comenzado hacer un cuarto, aún le falta levantar paredes, el techo, puertas, lo que hará con este nuevo financiamiento para avanzar más y pronto gozar de esta mejora. Materiales a comprar: bloque, cemento, arena, hierro y seguir la construcción de la obra.
texts.en:
María is still working as a cook in her sister's snack bar; they support each other mutually.  She has three married children and the moral and financial support of her husband.  He owns a taxi, which gives a larger percentage of the earnings, although the cost of gasoline is high.

Her goal has been to remodel her house, which she has been doing in the short term with the loans from AFODENIC and with savings.  She has begun to make a room.  She still has to raise the walls, the roof, and the doors, which she'll do with this new loan to make progress and soon enjoy the improvement.

She needs to buy concrete blocks, sand, and metal rods, and continue with the construction.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish a room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fungicides, urea, manure and insecticides

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Don Arturo es casado tiene 61 años de vida, descendiente de una familia agricultora, siempre trabajando en sus siembros, principal medio de ingresos, como en todo negocio algunas veces le va  bien y otras mal, pero como tiene variedad de cultivos siempre sale delante de una u otra manera y contando con el apoyo económico que le brindan sus hijos que ya son adultos le es más fácil seguir progresando, así también con el apoyo de KIVA y AFODENIC. Nuevamente está solicitando crédito para el mantenimiento de 4 manzanas de piña que en este momento tiene sembrado en la finca para comprar fertilizantes, urea, abono e insecticidas.
texts.en: Arturo is 61 years old and married.  He comes from a farming family and is always working on his crops which are his main source of income.  As is the case in all businesses, sometimes things go well and sometimes they go badly.  However, as he grows a variety of different crops, Arturo always manages to keep moving forward in one way or another.  He also has financial support from his children who are now adults and, with the support of Kiva and Afodenic as well, it is easier for him to continue making progress.  He is requesting a new loan to maintain four 'manzanas' (just under 7 acres) of pineapple crops which are growing on his farm.  He will buy fertilizers, urea, manure and insecticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies

loans.name: Walter Jose

texts.es: EL joven Walter habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa quien labora como comerciante, ella de esa manera cubre con los pagos básicos de la casa, tienen una niña de 5 añitos de edad que va a clases, sus deseos en un futuro es mejorar sus condiciones de vida, Walter por su parte desde hace muchos años labora como cadete de un taxi trabajo pesado y un poco peligroso, su salario no es suficiente ya que también tiene gastos para el hogar es por eso que acude a solicitar crédito para poder comprar laminas de sinc y perlines, para reparar el techo de su casa, que tiene muchos agujeros y cuando llueve pasa el agua al interior de la vivienda y es muy incomodo para ellos y su peña convivir de esa manera, el espera le sea aprobada su solicitud y agradece el apoyo que le brinden.
texts.en:
Walter lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife, who works as a merchant and so covers the basic household expenses.  They have a five-year-old little girl who goes to school.

His desire for the future is to improve his living conditions.  Walter has worked for many years as a taxi driver, a boring and slightly dangerous job.  His salary isn't enough because he also has household expenses.

This is why he's coming to request a loan to be able to buy sheets of corrugated metal and wood beams to repair the roof of his house.  The roof has a lot of holes and when it rains the water comes inside the house and it's very uncomfortable for them to live like this.

He hopes his loan will be approved and he's grateful for the help he's getting.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal and wood beams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy staple items, a display case, and beverages

loans.name: Donald Rogelio

texts.es:
Don Donald es un padre de tres hijos estudiantes, y que se esfuerza para poder dar una educación profesional  a sus hijos, para que gocen de un mejor porvenir él es de oficio, electricista industrial y trabaja por cuenta propia por contrato, hay día, que no tiene trabajo pero se ayuda con el  negocio de su pulpería que administra con su esposa. Lo que se ayudan para solventar los gastos básicos y alimentación.
El ah optado al financiamiento en Afodenic con ocho ciclos, lo que ha mejorado su vivienda, el cual está contento por poder obtener mejores condicione de habitacional, lo que construirá el baño y una bodega para una mejor higiene y orden en su hogar. Materiales a comprar: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, láminas de zinc, para comenzar la obra
texts.en: Donald is a father to three children, who are students and he works hard to be able to give a professional education to his children so they enjoy a better future. He is by trade an industrial electrician and he works on his own, by contract. Today he doesn't have work but he helps with the grocery store business that his wife manages which helps to pay for basic expenses and food. He has opted for loans from Afodenic eight times, thus improving his house. He is happy to be able to obtain better living conditions. He will build a bathroom and a pantry for better hygiene and order in his home. The materials to buy  to start the work are: blocks, sand, cement, iron, zinc sheets.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a bathroom and pantry, having better hygiene and order in his home.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemi de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos Cristian y Brenda, ella se dedica a la costura y tiene veinte años de experiencia que le permiten elaborar las mejores prendas, trabaja al gusto del cliente, cose camisas, blusas, vestidos entre otros, trata de estar a la vanguardia con muy buenos estilos y todo de primera calidad, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque su servicio es excelente y los precios accesibles; Noemi es una mujer enérgica, dedicada a su labor, luchadora siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito y esta dispuesta a trabajar duro para lograrlo, quiere acrecentar el negocio, pues últimamente aumento la demanda pero para ello necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela por mayor, hilos, agujas, etc. Noemi tiene buenas referencias de pago y asume la responsabilidad de cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y al mismo tiempo tiene la esperanza que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Noemi is forty-five years old and she lives with her life partner and their two children, Cristian and Brenda. She has been engaging in sewing for twenty years, and thanks to her experience she is able to create the best items of clothing. She works according to her customers’ tastes, sewing shirts, blouses and dresses among other clothes; she tries to keep up to date with her very good styles and her first-quality products. She already has many customers, as people prefer her because of her excellent service and her affordable prices. Noemi is a determined woman, devoted to her job; she is a tenacious person always waiting for new chances that will allow her to achieve her goals, and she is ready to work very hard to succeed. She wants to expand her activity because of the recent increase in the requests she receives, but as she needs money she is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL to buy cloth at wholesale prices, threads and needles. Noemi has good repayment references and she grants she will be able to repay her dues according to schedule. She hopes she will succeed in granting a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: To buy cloth at wholesale prices, threads and needles.

loans.name: Xiomara Yamileth

texts.es: Xiomara Yamileth de veinticuatro años de edad vive junto a su hijo y su abuela; ella posee un comedor donde vende ricos platillos como sopas, pollo, carne, plátanos fritos, ensaladas, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un excelente servicio; Xiomara es una mujer emprendedora con muchas metas por delante, quiere ganarse un futuro mejor y esta trabajando duro para lograrlo pues sabe que solo así obtendrá el éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere ampliar el negocio pero para ello necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar carnes, granos básicos, verduras, bebidas etc. Xiomara Yamileth tiene buenas referencias de pago y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez que tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Xiomara Yamileth, 24, lives with her son and her grandmother.  She has a snack bar where she sells delicious meals like soups, meat, chicken, fried bananas, salads, among others.  She’s been in business for several years and she’s acquired much experience that leads her to earn higher profits.  She has quite a few regular customers because people know that everything she sells is top quality at affordable prices; in addition her service is excellent.

Xiomara is an enterprising woman who has many future goals.  She wants to earn a better future and is working hard to do so because she knows that’s the only way to reach success.  Like all good merchants, she wants to increase business but needs capital to back her up which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy meat, basic grains, vegetables, beverages, etc.  Xiomara Yamileth has good payment references and is sure that she’ll be able to repay the loan.  At the same time, she’s confident that she’ll be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy meat, basic grains, vegetables and beverages.

loans.name: Ilusiones  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Ilusiones es un banco comunal que está conformado por 9 mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día para mejora la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y para salir adelante con sus familias, trabajan en distintas actividades las que le permiten ser independientes económicamente. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su clima frió, es una ciudad que se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno lo cual le regala a la ciudad su toque pintoresco y especial, su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Transito, se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en conjunto en su banco comunal, vive por la comunidad de San Miguel en la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, tiene 47 años, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos quienes son mayores de edad y están estudiando en una universidad de la ciudad, la casa en la que viven es el fruto del esfuerzo conyugal.
 
Doña Transito se dedica hace 25 años a la atención de su tienda, en su mismo local aprovecha para preparar y vender comida rápida, su trabajo lo realiza de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. También cría animales como: cerdos, pollos y cuyes que los vende cuando ya están gordos.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para surtir su tienda.
 
Su meta es mejorar su casita ya que por el tiempo se ha deteriorado.
texts.en:
Ilusiones Communal Bank is made up of nine women entrepreneurs who strive every day to improve the financial stability of their homes and to get ahead with their families.  They work in various jobs that allow them to be financially independent.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, known for its cold climate and a mix of colonial and modern that gives the city a quaint and special character.  The people still preserve the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

One of the members of this group is Transito.  She's on the fourth loan with her communal bank.  She lives in the community of San Miguel in the parish of El Valle in Cuenca.  She's 47 years old and divorced, and from her marriage has two adult children who study in a university in the city.  The house they live in is the fruit of her efforts and her husband's.
 
Transito has worked in her store for 25 years.  She makes the most of her own place to make and sell fast food.  She works every day of the week without a set schedule.  She also raises animals such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs, which she sells when they're fattened.

She's going to invest her loan in buying provisions to supply her store.

Her goal is to improve her little house because it has deteriorated over time.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Rilda Ines

texts.es: RILDA, ES UNA PERSONA TRABAJADORA, VIVEN EN LA PROVINCIA MIZQUE DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE COCHABAMBA,   TIENE UN HIJO, AL PADRE DE SU HIJO TUVO QUE DEJARLO POR EL MAL TRATO QUE LES DABA A SU HIJO Y A ELLA, AHORA  ELLA SOLA TIENE QUE MANTENER Y ALIMENTARLO A SU  PEQUEÑO. RILDA POR MOTIVOS DE PROBLEMAS FAMILIARES Y ECONÓMICOS NO PUDO CULMINAR SUS ESTUDIOS SUPERIORES  AHORA TIENE QUE MANTENERSE Y MANTENER SOLA A SU PEQUEÑO ELLA  ES MUY QUERIDA Y RESPETADA EN LA ZONA DONDE VIVE, POR LO DEDICADO A SU  TRABAJO Y SU  PEQUEÑO HIJO.  ELLA ESTÁ SOLICITANDO EL CRÉDITO PARA HACER REFACCIONAR LA CASITA QUE LE DEJO SUS PADRES AHÍ SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL DE RILDA  ES LA ATENCIÓN DE SERVICIO DE VENTA DE COMIDA. ELLA NECESITA MEJORAR EL AMBIENTE DONDE VENDE SUS COMIDAS PARA AUMENTAR SU VENTA Y ASI DE ESTA MANERA MEJORAR SUS INGRESO ECONÓMICO Y  DARLE ASI UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA A SU HIJO Y QUE  PUEDA ASISTIR A LA ESCUELA  EN MEJORES CONDICIONES.  EL CRÉDITO AYUDARA MUCHO A SU HIJO Y A ELLA EN EL DURO TRABAJO QUE REALIZA.
texts.en:
Rilda is a hardworking person living on Bolívar Street in Mizque Province, Cochabamba Department.  She has a son.  She had to leave her son’s father because of the bad way he treated her and their son and now she must support and feed her little one by herself.

Because of family and economic problems, Rilda was unable to finish higher education and now must support herself and her little one alone; she is very loved and respected in the area where she lives because of the ways he’s devoted to her work and her little son.

She’s requesting this loan to make some improvements to the house her parents left her.  Rilda’s main activity is selling food there.  She needs to improve the setting where she sells her meals to increase sales and improve her income to give her son a better quality of life so he can attend a better school.  The loan will help her son and her with the hard work she does.

loans.use: to refurbish her house.

loans.name: Nilson Oronte

texts.es: El joven Nilson, labora como contador en una empresa, por medio de una beca está estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en contabilidad y auditoría pública, por tal motivo solicita el crédito para poder comprar una computadora para hacer uso de ella en la universidad, de no ser posible este préstamo le afectaría por que trabaja en el día y estudia por la  noche, no podría hacer sus trabajos que se le encomienda, ya que el único tiempo que le queda es en la noche después de clases. Le interesa mucho su profesión porque hay mucha demanda y con sus conocimientos adquiridos, puede contribuir para un mejor desarrollo en el país y se beneficiaría teniendo un mejor estado de vida económico. El mensaje que nos comparte es que siempre está la puerta abierta para el deseo de superación de cada persona y con el apoyo de KIVA y AFODENIC, nos ayuda en gran manera a la población.
texts.en: Young Nilson works as an accountant in a company. Through a scholarship, he is studying to get a Bachelor's in public accounting and auditing. For this reason, he is requesting the loan to be able to buy a computer to use it at university. If this loan was not possible, it would affect him because he works during the day and studies at night. He would not be able to do his work that is entrusted to him since the only time left is at night after classes. His profession interests him a lot because there's a lot of demand and with his acquired knowledge he can contribute to the better development of the country and he would benefit having a better economic status. The message that he shares with us is that the door is always open for each person's desire to get ahead and the support of Kiva and Afodenic helps the population greatly.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe  DANAYA ont  en moyenne 33  ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de San, région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de céréales  et diverses marchandises. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  il y’a 6 ans et son à leur 12 eme  prêt solidaire. Tous les onze prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
Madame, Kadia Founè (1ère debout vers  la gauche  sur la photo) excelle dans la vente de céréales. Elle est très  appréciée et sollicitée dans la ville de San. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 4 sacs de 100 kg de riz, 2 sacs de petits mil et 3 sacs de haricot. Elle s’approvisionne tous les lundis à la foire de San auprès des producteurs et effectue ses ventes au grand marché de San et à domicile, au  comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. 
Avec ce prêt, elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and living for the most part in extended traditional families, the four women of the DANAYA group are around 33 years old and have four children on average. They all live in the same neighborhood of Hamdallaye in the city of San in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and know one another through proximity, business, and family. They buy and sell grains and various other goods. 

Six years ago, with the goal of satisfying their growing and demanding client base, the members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their 12th loan together. Their 11 previous loans were repaid without a problem. 

Madam Kadia Founè (first woman on the left) excels at selling grains. She is appreciated and sought after in the city of San. 

She plans on using her loan to buy four 100 kg bags of rice, two bags of millet, and three bags of beans. She buys her supplies from producers every Monday at the San market. She sells to a mixed clientele at the grand market of San and out of her home, at retail, and for cash and on credit. 

With this loan, she would like to earn an average monthly profit of 40.000 FCFA, which she'll use to reinvest in her business and help her spouse with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: San Pablo  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
San Pablo es un banco comunal conformado por 12 señoras que viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene su clima frió debido a su geografía accidentada, su arquitectura es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es de un corazón cálido y amable, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, su vestimenta es muy colorida la que le da vida a la ciudad. Nuestras socias son luchadoras, trabajadoras que laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades económicas las que les permiten ayudar a la solvencia económica de sus hogares para salir  adelante con sus familias, los créditos que han realizado en la banca comunal les han permitido mejorar su calidad de vida ya que el dinero lo invierten en sus negocios para seguir creciendo.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Olga,  vive por la comunidad de Narancay en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 33 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 15, 13, 11 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo pasa en casa ayudándole con los quehaceres del hogar y este año va a ingresar a estudiar en un colegio a distancia, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. La casa en la que vive con su familia es fruto de su trabajo.

Doña Olga hace 15 años trabaja ambulantemente en un mercado de la ciudad vendiendo frutas de temporada, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, en casa se da el tiempo para cuidar y vender sus cerdos, cuyes y pollos, también siembra en sus terrenos y sus cosechas son para el consumo de su hogar y el sobrante lo vende.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, pollos, cerdos y alimento para sus animales para seguir creciendo en esta actividad.
 
Su meta es tener un puesto propio para vender sus frutas.
texts.en:
San Pablo Communal Bank is made up of 12 women who live on the outskirts of Cuenca, a city that has a cold climate because of its rugged geography.  The architecture is a mixture of colonial and modern, the people are warm-hearted and pleasant and preserve the culture and traditions of their ancestors, and their colorful clothing gives life to the city.

The members are fighters, hardworking women who work daily in different jobs that allow them to pay the household expenses to get ahead with their families.  The loans they have received in the communal bank have allowed them to improve their quality of life because they invest the money in their businesses to keep growing.

One of the members of this group is Olga.  She lives in the Narancay community in the city of Cuenca.  She's 33 years old and a widow.  From her marriage she has four children, ages 15, 13, 11, and 6.  Her oldest child works and helps her financially.  Her second child is at home and helps with the chores, and this year will start studying in a school via distance education.  Her youngest two children go to school in town.  The house she lives in with her family is the fruit of her labor.

Olga has worked for 15 years as a street vendor selling seasonal fruit in a market in the city.  She works every day from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon.  At home she has the time to care for and sell her pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens.  She also grows food on her land; her harvests are for the family and she sells what's left over.
 
She's going to invest her new loan in buying guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and animal feed so she can continue to grow in this work.

Her goal is to have her own stall to sell her fruit.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and animal feed

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Ingénieur de profession, Madame Afi est âgée de 28 ans et est mère de 02 enfants. Elle associe à sa profession la revente de mèches et de cartes de recharge. Elle sollicite son second prêt auprès de notre institution pour acheter un stock de marchandises et booster son commerce. Elle souhaite ouvrir d’autres boutiques afin de pouvoir assurer le logement de sa famille.
texts.en: An engineer by profession, Madame Afi is 28 years old and the mother of 2 children. She sells hair extensions and recharge cards (for mobile phones). She is asking for her second loan with our institution to buy additional inventory and to boost her business. She would like to open other boutiques to help pay for her family's housing.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and recharge cards (for mobile phones).

loans.name: Cumbe Centro  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe Centro se encuentra conformado por 6 mujeres quienes son la mayoría familia y amigas, laboran diariamente en las actividades de la ganadería, cría de animales pequeños, agricultura y comercio, estas actividades les permiten ser mujeres dependientes económicamente y así ayudan a mejorar la economía de sus hogares, son personas amables que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven en la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca lugar que se encuentra rodeada por montañas las que le dan hermosos paisajes para disfrutar de la naturaleza, tiene clima es frió pero su gente tiene un muy corazón cálido, mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. Silvia, tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, su padre es carpintero y su madre se dedica a la ganadería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señorita Silvia al igual que su madre se dedica a la cría de ganado, actividad que la desempeña hace  12 años porque tienen terrenos para dedicarse a esta actividad, la leche que obtiene de su ganado la vende en los carros lecheros. Cría y vende gallinas y cuyes y también se dedica a la agricultura, las cosechas que obtiene las utiliza solo para el consumo de su hogar. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para su ganado.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Cumbe Centro community bank has six female members who are mainly family members and friends.  They work every day in their businesses raising livestock, farming and selling products.  These activities allow them to be financially independent women and help improve their household finances.  They are kind people who still maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.  They live in Cumbe parish, in Cuenca.  This area is surrounded by mountains.  The landscape is beautiful and people are able to enjoy nature.  The climate is cold but the people have warm hearts.

One of the members of this group is 29-year-old Silvia.  Silvia is single and lives with her parents, with whom she shares the household expenses.  Her father is a carpenter and her mother raises cattle.  They do not own their own home but live in rental accommodation.

Silvia and her mother raise cattle.  They have been doing this for 12 years because they have the land they need to carry out this business.  They sell the milk that they obtain from their cows on milk floats.  They raise and sell hens and guinea pigs and also farm.  Their harvests are solely for their own household consumption.

Silvia will invest her loan money in buying feed for her cattle.  Her goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Spécialisé dans la revente de pagnes de bazins, Irène est épouse d’un infirmier d’Etat. Elle est âgée de 29 ans et est mère de 01 enfant de 02 ans. Elle à démarrer ce commerce en 2009 et sollicite un second prêt auprès de notre institution. Dans le but de formaliser son commerce et de devenir un grand traitant, elle compte réinvestir les profits supplémentaire dans son activité.
texts.en:
Specializing in the resale of cloth and brocade, Irène is married to a registered nurse. She is 29 years old and the mother of a two-year-old child.

Irène began her business in 2009 and is requesting her second loan with our organization. With the goal of expanding her business and becoming a larger enterprise, she plans to reinvest the additional profits into her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and brocade

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, urea, and ammonium sulfate fertilizer.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale Afiwa est une jeune dame mariée de 33 ans. Ses 04 enfants sont tous scolarisés à l’exception du dernier qui est âgé de 01 an. L’ainé quand à lui est âgé de 13 ans. Elle sollicite son troisième crédit qui sera consacré à son commerce auprès de notre institution pour l’achat de ses  produits de distribution. Elle aimerait disposer d’une boutique pour son commerce qu’elle pratique déjà à son domicile.
texts.en: At 33 years of age, Afiwa is a young married woman and grocery retailer. Her four children are all enrolled in school, except for the youngest who is only one year old. Her oldest child is 13 years old. Afiwa is seeking her third loan, which she will use to purchase additional groceries for resale. Her goal is to help her business to grow. Afiwa would eventually like to earn enough income to open a shop where she can sell her groceries, as she currently operates her business from her home.

loans.use: to purchase various groceries for resale.

loans.name: Dania Veronica

texts.es:
Dania es una joven de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Dania trabaja brindando servicios de impresión y venta de sellos, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana ella asiste a un pequeño mercado de su ciudad para iniciar sus labores, Dania puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Dania se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir sus gastos médicos, ya q	ue necesita hacerse un análisis general y comprar los medicamentos que requiera para calmar sus dolencias; de esta manera Dania espera mejorar su salud, para así poder seguir trabajando y junto con su familia desea poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dania is a 20 year old young woman. She is single. She lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona with her parents and siblings.
