Su principal actividad económica se centra en la venta de productos de belleza al por menor, es decir compra las cremas, joyas y perfumes por cantidad, ya que de esta manera podrá brindar un mejor precio a sus clientes, quienes gustan muchos de las ofertas para poder comprar más accesorios, ya tiene 7 años dedicándose a este negocio; en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y muy comprometida con el bienestar de sus clientes, “por ese motivo tengo mucha clientela”, menciona muy orgullosa. Ahora espera con muchas ansias poder adquirir los productos que solicita pues ya llega la temporada de navidad y tiene que tener productos para poder ofrecer a buen precio. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Mujeres Victorianas” y este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Belisa, invertirá el dinero en la compra de gran cantidad de productos en belleza por catálogos, pues necesita de un stock para seguir vendiendo.
texts.en:
Belisa, 35 years old, is a hardworking woman and a good daughter.  She lives in the company of her parents and brothers in their house and has since she was born.  She lives together with her parents and looks after them with great care.  Her principal economic activity centers on the sale of retail beauty products, that is to say she buys creams, jewels and perfumes in bulk, since in this way she can offer a better price to her customers, who very much like the bargains so they can buy more accessories.  She already has seven years dedicated to this business.  In all of this time she proved to be a responsible person and very committed to the wellbeing of her customers.  “For this reason I have many customers,” she mentions very proudly.

Now she eagerly hopes to be able to acquire requested products since the Christmas season is already coming and she has to have products to be able to offer a good price.  She belongs to the mutually supportive group “Mujeres Victorianas” and this is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to have a financial support, since she has always proven to be responsible in her payments.  Also she is grateful to be a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive.  Belisa will invest the money in the purchase of a great quantity of beauty products by catalogue, as she needs stock to continue selling.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Enith, es una mujer de 39 años, emprendedora y muy trabajadora, es soltera pero tiene 3 hijos de 18, 15 y 7 años de edad, vive junto a ellos en su casa propia que construyó su ex cónyuge mientras vivía a su lado, ahí comparte el mismo deseo de superarse y salir adelante por el bien de toda su familia. Nuestra amiga Enith desarrolla varias actividades económicas, pero de entre todas dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo a la venta de abarrotes. Tiene su bodega instalada en la casa de su madre, funciona desde hace 3 años y ahí ofrece a la venta todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, pan, leche, huevos, embutidos, gaseosas, etc. En ocasiones, cuando se encuentra ausente realizando otros trabajos, recibe la ayuda de su madre en la atención o de alguno de sus hijos. Eventualmente trabaja vendiendo comida en la vereda de su casa o también pone a la venta diferentes prendas de vestir y cosméticos dependiendo de la temporada. Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque los ingresos que percibe de su negocio han cubierto sus expectativas y le dan tranquilidad y sosiego para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y además de ello no hace esfuerzo alguno. Espera consolidar su negocio poco a poco y más adelante construir una tienda más grande. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera responsable y puntual, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas solidarias y muy cumplidas.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 800), incrementará la cantidad de productos en su bodega comprando arroz, azúcar, huevos y otros artículos necesarios para la venta, además incrementará su stock de cosméticos con la compra de perfumes, cremas, talcos y productos de maquillaje.
texts.en:
Enith, 39 years old, is an enterprising and very hardworking woman.  She is single, but has three children who are 7, 15, and 18 years old.  She lives with them in her own house that her ex-husband built while he lived with them.  She wants to improve and get ahead for the good of all of her family.  Enith works doing a variety of economic activities, but of all of them, she spends the most time selling groceries.  She has a small store located in her mother's house which has been open for three years.  There she sells all types of basic items such as rice, sugar, oil, bread, milk, eggs, sausage, and sodas.  On occasions when she is absent doing other work, her mother or one of her children helps her at the store.  She also works selling food on the sidewalk outside her house or selling different clothing items and cosmetics, depending on the season.  She likes what she does because the income from her work covers her expenses and gives her tranquility and peace to cover her basic necessities.  She wants to consolidate her business slowly and build a larger store in the future.  

This is her first loan with MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity and the confidence that they have in her to receive this loan.  She promises to make her payments responsibly and on time.  She is also grateful to be a part of her community bank since she has seen that the members are supportive and thoughtful people.  With the loan provided, she will purchase products for her bodega such as rice, sugar, eggs, and other necessary items, as well as increase her stock of cosmetics by purchasing perfumes, creams, talcum powder, and makeup products.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and eggs, as well as cosmetics such as perfume, creams, and talcum powder.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca, de 41 años es una mujer trabajadora. Es natural de Huancavelica pero, radica desde hace 13 años en la ciudad  de Huancayo con su esposo, Edilberto y su pequeño hijo en casa de sus suegros desde hace 10 años. Es docente de profesión  y desempeña su trabajo como profesora de personas adultas, enseñándoles a leer y escribir y también de manera paralela tiene otras actividades, principalmente la crianza de cuyes, venta de gelatinas de diversos sabores y tamaños. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la generación de sus negocios, en su granja de cuyes cuida  con mucho empeño para después vender  todos los fines de semana, selecciona a los cuyes que ha de vender y después los beneficia y entrega a  los comerciantes de carne de su localidad. Ha visto que todos estos negocios la ayudan y benefician en la economía de su hogar y le permite disponer de su propio tiempo es por esta razón que desea seguir trabajando con esa mismo empeño para  crecer económicamente. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Mujeres Victorianas” y este es el crédito número 7 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Rebeca; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de madera por cantidad, ya que piensa realizar la división de los establos de sus animales.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 41, is a hardworking woman who was born in Huancavelica. She moved to the city of Huancayo 13 years ago and has lived with her husband Edilberto and young son in her in-laws´ house for 10 years. She is a teacher who instructs adults in reading and writing. She also does other work, mainly raising guinea pigs and selling a variety of flavors and sizes of gelatines, and has devoted 7 years to these businesses. She raises guinea pigs on her farm, and each weekend she selects those that are ready to sell and takes them to local butchers.  

Rebeca has seen how these businesses help her household economically and let her use her time efficiently. This is the reason she wants to keep working hard and growing financially. She belongs to the “Mujeres Victorianas” communal bank, and this is its 7th loan cycle with MFP. She is happy to have the financial support, and she has made her payments on time. She also is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and caring people. Rebeca will use the loan to buy bulk wood to divide her animals´stables.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Acción Luchadora  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Este es el primer crédito que realizan las 6 socias y 2 socios que conforman el banco comunal  Acción Luchadora, todas son vecinas, amigas o familia que viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que nos regala un viaje al pasado por la belleza colonial de su Centro Histórico y por la tradicional vestimenta de su gente, quienes son de un corazón cálido y amable como nuestras socias, que son mujeres luchadoras que laboran el día a día para mejorar su estabilidad económica para salir adelante con sus familias. Aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, forma parte de la banca comunal hace 2 años pero esta es la primera vez que realiza su crédito con el banco comunal Acción Luchadora, vive por la comunidad de Rumiloma en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca. 

Tiene 50 años de edad, está separada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, solo una de sus hijas está casada y vive independiente, sus cuatro hijos se dedican al negocio de la familia ya que son comerciantes de ropa, con esta actividad aportan a la economía de la casa, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Rosa hace 15 años es comerciante de una gran variedad de prendas de vestir, vende su mercadería 4 días a la semana en un puesto propio que tiene en un mercado de la ciudad, labora sin un horario fijo, los demás días se dedica enteramente al cuidado de su hogar.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería y complacer a su exigente clientela. 

Su sueño es comprarse una casa para dejar de pagar arriendo.

La foto pequeña es de un socio que no puda estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
This is the first loan that the communal bank "Acción Luchadora" has taken.  The group is made up of 6 women and 2 men who are all neighbors, friends or family.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca is a city that gives you a trip to the past with its colonial beauty, its historic center, and the traditional dress of its people.  The people here have warm hearts and are friendly, like the members of this group, who are tenacious women who work each day to improve their economic stability and get ahead with their families.  The people of Cuenca still maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

One of the members of this group is Rosa.  She joined the communal bank 2 years ago, but this is the first time that she is taking a loan with the communal bank Acción Luchadora.  She lives in the community of Rumiloma on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.

Rosa is 50 years old and is separated.  In her marriage, she conceived 5 children who are all now grown.  Only one of her daughters is married and lives independently.  Her other 4 children work in the family business selling clothing.  With this activity they support the household finances.  The family does not have their own house, so they live in a rented dwelling.

For 15 years, Rosa has been selling a large variety of garments.  She sells her merchandise 4 days a week at a stall that she has in a market in the city.  She works without a fixed schedule, and when she is not working she devotes herself to taking care of the house.

Rosa will invest this loan in the purchase of clothing to stock up her business with merchandise and satisfy her demanding customers.

Rosa's dream is to buy a house so that she can stop paying rent. 

The small photo is of a member who could not be present when the group photograph was taken.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 23 años, es una mujer muy jovial, carismática y muy trabajadora, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 5 años, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a ellos y a su pequeño hijo luchando diariamente para salir adelante y mejorar su situación de vida. Julia se dedica a la venta de pollos. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano en su puesto que tiene instalado en las inmediaciones del mercado principal de la ciudad. Su trabajo consiste en ofrecer al público los más frescos y saludables pollos que sus proveedores le entregan y que ella se encarga de dividir en presas o cuartos para venderlos a precios cómodos. Lleva en este negocio más de 3 años y le va muy bien. Adicionalmente vende productos regionales como papaya, plátanos y cítricos que le brindan un ingreso adicional para cubrir sus necesidades básicas. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que su tiempo laboral culmina al mediodía y eso le permite descansar por las tardes o dedicar su tiempo libre a otras actividades del hogar, además le esta yendo muy bien ya que genera muchos ingresos para su familia y su pequeño hijo, ahora tiene muchos planes para su negocio que espera consolidar pronto. Este es el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta de saber que le brindan el acceso a una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas para continuar en el futuro. Asegura que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo responsable  y unido.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000), comprará pollos para ponerlos a la venta en su puesto, su inversión en cada compra varía entre 800 a 1000 soles.
texts.en:
Julia, age 23, is a very jovial, charismatic, and hard-working woman.  She is single, and she has a five year old child.  She lives in her parents’ house with them and her small son.  She struggles every day to get ahead in order to improve her life circumstances.

Julia sells chickens.  She starts work early every day at the stand she has established in the vicinity of the main market in the city.  Her job consists of offering the public the freshest and most healthy chickens that her providers deliver to her.  She takes charge of quartering them in order to sell at reasonable prices.  She has been in this business for over three years, and it is going very well for her.

She also sells regional products like papayas, bananas, and citrus fruits, which give her an additional income in order to cover her basic necessities.  She really likes what she does because her work schedule ends midday.  This allows her to rest in the afternoons or to spend her free time on household activities.  This is also going very well for her because it generates a lot of income for her family and young son.

She now has many plans for her business, which she hopes to incorporate soon.  This is her second loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she is granted access to a loan so that she can advance with her business.  She pledges to be responsible with her payments in order to continue in the future.  She affirms that she likes working with her communal bank, and she considers her group to be responsible and united.

She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy chickens to sell at her stand.  Her investment in each purchase will varied between 800 and 1000 soles.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén de 31 años de edad, es un hombre laborioso; vive en su propia casa a base de madera  con su pareja Karin de 31 años y sus 04 queridos hijos. Rubén, es un padre responsable, se dedica a la venta de comestibles (cereales, verduras, conservas, dulces, etc.); esta actividad lo realiza en su propio hogar hace 05 años y siempre cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja; gracias a su labor logra sacar adelante a sus hijos; asimismo se dedica a la agricultura y tiene su parcela con cultivos de café ya que son rentables en su venta.
Con el tiempo desea mejorar su casa y construirla a base de material noble, de esa manera tener una buena calidad de vida,para ello siempre está pendiente en su negocio, es por eso que siempre cuenta con los préstamos de MFP, para que cada vez logre mejorar su tienda.
Con el crédito que obtendra comprará productos de comestible para su tienda. Este es su crédito número 08, por tanto espera su apoyo para seguir logrando con su negocio. En su banco comunal es un socio participativo y activo, le gusta trabajar cos sus socios, ya son personas responsables con sus cuotas de pago.
Con los 1,500 nuevos, realizará la compra de víveres, cereales, verduras, bebidas, entre lo necesario para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rubén, 31 years old, is a hard-working man.  He lives in his own house made of wood with his partner Karin, 31 years old, and their four beloved children.  Rubén is a responsible father.  He works selling food (cereal, vegetables, canned goods, sweets, etc).  He has done this work from his home for five years and always has the support of his partner.  In addition, he works in agriculture and has land planted with coffee, which is profitable when sold.  His hard work is helping his children get ahead.

In time, he wants to improve his house and build it from hardwood, which will improve his family's quality of life.  To do this, he is always tending his store, and he also counts on loans from MFP, because every time he succeeds in improving his store.  With the loan, he will purchase food products for his store.  This is his eighth loan, and he is waiting for your support to continue succeeding with this business.  In his community bank, he is an active participating member.  He likes to work with the other members since they are responsible with their payments.  With this 1,500 nuevos soles, he will purchase groceries, cereal, vegetables, drinks, and other items necessary for his store.

loans.use: to purchase cereal, vegetables, and drinks.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es:
Kelly, de 31 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, lleva una relación de convivencia con Victor quien el padre de sus dos hijos de 1 y 5 años de edad respectivamente. Vive en la casa de su madre, en donde le asignaron un espacio para habitarlo con su familia. Kelly, tiene como principal labor la venta de comida. Vende en la vereda de la casa de su madre. Realiza su trabajo a diario y pone a la venta durante el día distintos menús, por las noches vende pollo broaster mientras que cada fin de semana prepara cebiche. Afirma que su principal platillo que deleita a diario a su clientela es el conocido potaje regional llamado “pango” elaborado a base de pescado seco salado acompañado de pedazos de plátano cocinado. Sus ganancias por todo su trabajo son muy buenas y eso la anima a seguir adelante. Lleva en este rubro más de 2 años y lo hace con ayuda de su madre y de sus hermanos. Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener un restaurante donde pueda ofrecer todos sus potajes durante toda la semana, y no en horarios diferentes y en días específicos como actualmente lo hace, aunque ya ha ganado experiencia en éste trabajo siente que todavía le sigue siendo difícil complacer a sus clientes porque no prepara muchos platillos para escoger, sin embargo espera hacerlo en poco tiempo con una mayor inversión. Este es el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP agradece a todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues  considera que es un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 800), comprará una cocina para que prepare carnes asadas, renovará algunos utensilios y además comprará algunos ingredientes e insumos para continuar trabajando en la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Kelly, age 31 is a good, friendly, and very hard-working woman. She co-habitates with Victor, who is the father of her two children, ages 1 and 5 respectively. She lives in her mother's house, where she was allocated a space to live with her family. 

Kelly, as her primary job, sells food. She sells in the path in front of her mother's house. She does her job daily, and during the day puts up different menus for sale. At night she sells roasted chicken, while every weekend she makes ceviche [a seafood dish typically made with raw fish marinated in citrus juice]. She confirms that her main dish that delights her customers daily is the well-known regional stew called "pango," which has a base of dried, salted fish with pieces of cooked plantains.

Her earnings from all of her work are very good, and this motivates her to keep going. She's been in this business for more than two years, and does it with the help of her mother and siblings. For the future of her business, she hopes to have a restaurant where she can offer all her stews during the entire week, and not just at different times on specific days as she does now. Even though she has gained experience in this line of work, she feels that it's still difficult to please her customers because she doesn't prepare many dishes to choose from. However, she hopes to do so shortly with a big investment. 

This is her second loan with the institution MFP; she appreciates everyone who has made this loan possible, as with it she feels confident advancing her business. On the other hand, she's very happy with her community bank and considers it a united and supportive group. 

With the amount requested (800 PEN), she will buy a cook top to prepare "carnes asadas" [grilled or barbecued meats], update some utensils, and furthermore buy some ingredients and goods to continue working in food sales.

loans.use: to buy a stove, utensils, and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Digna Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Digna hace 2 años forma parte del banco comunal Pauteñitas, vive por los alrededores del cantón de Paute, lugar que tienen un clima templado propicio para la una gran variedad de frutas y más aun para la floricultura de donde se cosechan las más hermosas flores, su gente es amable y cordial, se dedican a la agricultura, cría de animales y al comercio.

La Señora. Digan tiene 47 años, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo que ahora ya es mayor de edad, casado y vive independiente. Su esposo es comerciante y la casa en la que viven es el sacrificio del trabajo conyugal.
 
Ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, cuyes y ganado de los que vende la leche, también se dedica a la agricultura y su cosecha la vende y  la utiliza para el consumo de su hogar. Los fines de semana  prepara y vende  platos típicos como la fritada de cerdo. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir  en la compra de pollos y cerdos para continuar con la crianza de estos animales.
 
Su meta realizar algunos acabados que le faltan a su casa.
texts.en:
For 2 years, Digna has been a part of the communal bank, Pauteñitas. 

She lives in the surrounding area of the canton of Paute, a place that has a mild climate. The climate brings about a large variety of fruits and is good for the plant-life where they grow some of the most beautiful flowers. The people of Paute are friendly and cordial. They make a living in agriculture, animal husbandry, and commerce. 

Digna, 47, is married from which she has one adult child. Her husband is a merchant, and the house they live in is a result of their sacrifice.

She makes a living raising pigs, guinea pigs, and cattle from which they sell milk. She also works in agriculture; she sells some of her crops and grows some for her family's consumption. On the weekends, she cooks and sells traditional dishes like fried pork.

Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens and pigs to continue breeding those animals. 

Her goal is to complete some finishing touches on her home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Acacia De Ticuantepe Group

texts.es:
27.	Acacia de ticuantepe 
El grupo Acacia de Ticuantepe lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Anastasia quien se dedica a la venta de ropa la cual exporta a uno de los países vecinos. Ella invertirá en bóxer, biquinis, shors, mono, blusas.
Las otras integrantes son Maynor quien se dedica a la venta de sandalias y tiene una moto taxi desde hace 2 años y Tania quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
The "Acacia de Ticuantepe" group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people. One of them is Anastasia, who sells clothing that she exports to one of the neighboring countries. She will use the money to buy boxer shorts, bikinis, shorts, leotards and blouses. 

The other members are Maynor, who sells sandals, and has had a mototaxi for two years, and Tania, who sells clothing.

loans.use: To buy clothing such as boxer shorts, bikinis, shorts, leotards and blouses.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor, de 62 años es una mujer honesta, responsable y muy trabajadora, convive desde hace 42 años José y junto a él tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, vive en su casa propia y comparte sus días con su cónyuge viviendo día a día su lucha por salir adelante. El trabajo de Leonor consiste en la elaboración de joyas de oro y plata. Tiene un taller artesanal ubicado en su casa en donde confecciona manualmente cada una de las joyas que previamente han sido escogidas por sus clientes. Tiene mucha paciencia lo cual le sirve para plasmar con mucho cuidado cada uno de los detalles que requiere la pieza. En algunas ocasiones a elaborado piezas exclusivas que han sido creadas por los propios clientes. También reparan relojes y realizan grabados y “engaste” en las sortijas. Su trabajo lo ejecuta con ayuda de su esposo. Lleva en esta actividad más de 40 años y le va muy bien. Adicionalmente tiene un mototaxi propio que diariamente alquila desde hace 10 años pero que actualmente se encuentra funcionando mal por el paso de los años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que siente al diseñar un joya, le agrada ver su trabajo final y la belleza que observa en cada artículo hecho por sus propias manos, le agrada además compartir y desarrollar está pasión con su cónyuge y eso la motiva a seguir adelante. Espera implementar pronto su taller para continuar trabajando con mejores resultados. Este es el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta de saber que le brindan el acceso a una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas para continuar en el futuro. Asegura que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo responsable y unido.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000) comprará repuestos de relojes y algunas herramientas que usa en la confección de las joyas, por otra parte comprará ciertos repuestos que necesita su vehículo para tener un buen funcionamiento.
texts.en:
Leonor, 62, is an honest, responsible, and hard-working. She has lived with José, her husband, for 42 years. They have 6 adult children. She lives in her own house and shares her days with her husband working day by day. 

Leonor's work involves creating jewelry from gold and silver. She has a workshop located in her house where she assembles the customer's hand-picked jewels into hand-made jewelry. She has a lot of patience which helps her accentuate the detail required in each piece. On certain occasions, she made special parts created for her own customers jewelry.

In addition, she repairs watches, does engraving, and performs mounting for rings. Her work is done with the help of her husband. She has been in this field for 40 years and it treats her well.

She also has a motorcycle taxi that she rents out daily. She has been in this business for 10 years, but currently the motorcycle is not working properly due to its age. 

What she likes about her jobs is the freedom she feels in designing jewelry. She likes seeing the final product and the beauty in each of the pieces she made by hand. She also likes sharing and developing this passion with her husband. This motivated her to continue forward.

She soon hopes to install a workshop to continue working and produce better results.

This is her second loan with MFP. She is happy to know that they are offering a line of credit to improve upon her business. For this reason, she promises to be responsible with her payments to continue into the future. She feels strongly about and likes her communal bank because she considers them to be a responsible and united group. 

With the amount asked, 1000 nuevos soles, she will buy spare watch parts, tools to be used in making jewelry, and specific motorcycle parts to have it in working order.

loans.use: to buy spare watch parts and some tools to make jewelry, and spare motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Martha Noemi

texts.es:
La Señora Martha hace un año que forma parte del banco comunal Pauteñitas, vive por los alrededores del cantón de Paute, lugar que tienen un clima templado propicio para la una gran variedad de frutas y más aun para la floricultura de donde se cosechan las más hermosas flores, su gente es amable y cordial, se dedican a la agricultura, cría de animales y al comercio.

La Señora. Martha es una mujer muy joven, tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo se dedica al comercio, no tienen casa propia aun por lo que viven arrendando.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Herbalife, para vender este producto tiene su propio local en el que labora de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde ya que el resto de su tiempo lo dedica a su hogar. También es dueña de un camión en el cual realiza transporte pesado y en casa cría cerdos y cuyes.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos naturales.
 
Su sueño es viajar por varios países del mundo.
texts.en:
A year ago, Martha joined the Pauteñitas communal bank. She lives on the outskirts of Paute, which has the perfect temperate climate for growing a range of fruits and harvesting the most beautiful flowers. The friendly, polite people farm, raise livestock, and own businesses. Martha is 26, married, and has 2 children, ages 5 and 2. Her oldest son attends a local elementary school, and her husband is a businessman. They rent a house since they do not own their own. 

Martha sells Herbalife natural products from her own stall where she works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. She spends the rest of the day taking care of her home. She also owns a truck to transport fish and raises pigs and guinea pigs at her house. She will use this loan to buy natural products. She dreams of traveling to other countries.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Meliza

texts.es:
Meliza, de 34 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla y sobre todo muy trabajadora, convive desde hace muchos años con Abraham con quien tiene tres hijos de 15, 7 y 3 años de edad respectivamente. vive en su casa propia que construyó con su pareja en donde comparte con su familia la misma disposición de lucha continua y arduo trabajo. El trabajo de Meliza consiste en la venta de abarrotes, verduras y gaseosas, su negocio está en su casa que se encuentra ubicada en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad, todos los días atiende muchos clientes que acuden a su tienda en busca de todo tipo de productos que ella tiene para ofrecer, siempre atiende al público con mucho cariño, respeto y amabilidad, aún recuerda cuando emprendió este negocio hace aproximadamente 1 año y desde ahí tuvo muchas dificultades como la competencia de otras tiendas pero que afortunadamente ha ido superando, ahora su tienda es muy visitada pues ofrece gran variedad de productos a buen precio. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite dedicar su tiempo a múltiples actividades del hogar, además le esta yendo muy bien ya que genera muchos ingresos para su familia, ahora tiene muchos planes para su negocio entre ellos está la ampliación de su local de atención y así poder vender diversos productos en mayor cantidad que incrementen sus ganancias. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 900), comprará cierta cantidad de abarrotes que no tiene actualmente como condimentos y  algunos embutidos.
texts.en:
Meliza, 34 years old, is a kind, simple, and hardworking woman.  She has lived for many years with Abraham, with whom she has three children who are 3, 7, and 15 years old.  She lives in her own house that her partner built where she shares with her family the same attitude of continuous struggle and hard work.  

Meliza works selling groceries, vegetables, and soft drinks.  Her business is in her home, which is located on a very busy street in the city.  Every day she attends to many customers who come to her store in search of all types of products that she has to offer.  She always serves her customers with care, respect, and kindness.  She still remembers when she started this business about one year ago.  Since then she has had many difficulties, such as competition from other stores, but fortunately she has succeeded and now her store is very popular because it offers a large variety of products at good prices.  She likes that her work allows to her dedicate her time to multiple activities in the home, and also that it is going well since it generates income for her family.  Now she has many plans for her business, including expanding her store so that she can sell different products in larger quantities to increase her earnings.  

This is her second loan with MFP, and she is thankful to everyone that made her loan possible so that she can continue with her objectives.  She promises to make all of her payments on time.  She is happy to be a part of her community bank since all of the members are kind and supportive people.  With the loan requested, she will purchase groceries that she doesn't carry currently, such as condiments and sausages.

loans.use: to purchase condiments and sausages for her grocery store.

loans.name: Noyda

texts.es:
Noyda, de 40 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, está casada desde hace algunos años con Wagner quien es el padre de sus 3 hijos cuyas edades son 13, 6 y 3 años de edad respectivamente. Vive en su casa propia con toda su familia y todos comparten la dicha de seguir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Noyda, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, plátano, verduras, tubérculos, aceite, huevos, pan, leche y otros. Tiene instalado su bodega en su casa desde hace 2 años y afortunadamente le va muy bien debido a que su vivienda está ubicada en una de las avenidas principales de la ciudad, y además no tiene competencia cercana, sus ventas son muy fluidas y eso le permite tener siempre gran cantidad de clientes que atiende a diario. Eventualmente le ayuda a atender su hija mayor mientras ella realiza otras labores. En ocasiones trabaja brindando clases de reforzamiento estudiantil ya que es docente, aunque por ahora lamentablemente no desarrolla su profesión a cabalidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que no le demanda mucho esfuerzo y puede mantenerse en reposo, manteniendo controlada su salud y le agrada el ritmo con el que va creciendo su puesto de abarrotes. Espera incrementar la cantidad y variedad de los artículos que vende actualmente y de esta manera mejorar aún más sus ingresos económicos. Este es el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, es por ello que agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito financiero para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000), comprará productos de primera necesidad con los que surtirá su puesto de ventas de abarrotes como leche, azúcar, arroz y otros, su inversión en cada compra varía de 500 a 600 soles.
texts.en:
Noyda, 40 years old, is a kind and hardworking woman.  She has been married for a number of years to Wagner, who is the father of her three children, who are 3, 6, and 13 years old.  She lives in her own home with all of her family and they all share the desire to get ahead and improve their quality of life.

Noyda works selling groceries such as rice, plantains, vegetables, tubers, oil, eggs, bread, milk, and other items.  She built a small store in her house two years ago.  Fortunately it as been going very well since her home is located on one of the main avenues of the city and she does not have close competition.  Her sales are very fluid and this allows her to always have a large number of customers to attend every day.  Sometimes her oldest daughter helps her serve customers while she does other work.  Occasionally she works giving remedial classes to students since she is a teacher, however for now, unfortunately, she is not working in her profession.  

The thing she likes best about her work is that it does not take much effort and she can rest and maintain her health.  She likes the rhythm with which her grocery store is growing.  She hopes to increase the quantity and variety of the items she currently sells and improve her income.  This is her second loan with MFP, and she is thankful to everyone who provided the opportunity for access to a loan provider so that she could realize her plans.  She also likes her community bank because she knows the members and considers them supportive and responsible people.  With the loan requested, she will purchase staple products to stock her store such as milk, sugar, rice, and other items.  Her investment in each purchase varies from 500 to 600 soles.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Nueva Ilusión es un banco comunal que está conformado hace 5 años, lo conforman 8 socias que son amigas y vecinas las cuales viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza y salir de la rutina de la ciudad, su clima es frió pero su gente es de un corazón cálido, como nuestras socias quienes son mujeres de un gran carisma que enfrentan las adversidades de la mejor manera siempre pensando en el bienestar de sus familias, su mayor orgullo es que a aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Carmen, forma parte del banco comunal Nueva Ilusión  hace un año y medio, tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y es madre de 2 hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad que están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil trabajo que lo aprendido de su padre, la casa en la que viven es el fruto del trabajo conyugal.
 
Doña Carmen se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y familia pero para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar cría cerdos, gallinas y cuyes a los que los vende en su comunidad, también labora en la agricultura y lo que le produce es para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una ternera para criarla y luego venderla. 

Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
Nueva Ilusión (New Illusion) is a communal bank that was formed 5 years ago. It is made up of 8 members who are friends and neighbours who live in the vicinity of the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca, a place that has several places to enjoy nature and to leave the routine of the city. Its climate is cold but its people are warm-hearted like our members, who are women of great charisma who face adversity in the best way always thinking about the well-being of their families. Their greatest pride is that they still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of this group is Carmen who has been a member of the communal bank Nueva Ilusión for one and a half years. She is 37 years old, married and is the mother of 2 children ages 16 and 14 who are studying in a school in the city. Her husband works as a builder, work that he learned from his father. The house in which they live in is the fruit of their combined labours.

Carmen works at home taking care of the house and family but to help her husband with household expenses she raises pigs, chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her community. She also farms and what she produces is consumed in the home.

She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of a calf to raise it and then sell it.

Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Mary

texts.fr:
Agé de 36 ans Monsieur Mary est un homme marié qui est  père de 2 enfants, résidant avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son père, dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni.
Il abandonna l’école en classe de 6 eme années fondamentales (système éducatif Malien) au profit des activités génératrices de revenus.
Il avait tanté plusieurs activités notamment la vente de chaussures et tissus, sans réussite. Il décida alors d’accompagner son oncle pour apprendre la vente de céréales.
Avec une expérience de plus de 3 années, il maîtrise son activité qu’il mène au grand marché de Bougouni et dans le autres marchés hebdomadaires. 
Pour agrandir son entreprise, il décida d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après deux prêts tous correctement remboursés il est à son troisième, qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 2 tonnes de maïs, 2 tonnes de petit mil et 3 tonnes de riz. Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni auprès des grossistes et dans les villages  environnants auprès des paysans producteurs.
La vente se fait au grand marché de Bougouni et une partie est vendue dans les différents villages les jours de marché hebdomadaires.
Avec ce prêt il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour rembourser le prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Mary, aged 36, is a married man and the father of two children. He resides with his wife and children at his father's house, in the Heremakono Nord district of Bougouni City. He dropped out of 6th grade (Malian education system) for revenue-generating work. He had attempted several businesses, especially selling shoes and cloth but unsuccessfully. He then decided to join his uncle to learn how to sell grains. With over three years of experience, he has a mastery of his business, which he runs at the big market of Bougouni and at other weekly markets. 

To expand his enterprise, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. After two loan, both correctly repaid, he is now on his third loan, which he intends to use to purchase 2 tonnes of corn, 2 tonnes of pearl millet, and 3 tonnes of rice from wholesale merchants and from peasant producers from surrounding villages. His sales are made at different villages on weekly market days.

With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan, to cover family expenses, and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase grains to sell

loans.name: Doussoussouma Group

texts.fr:
Composé de 4 femmes mariées, les membres du groupe DOUSSOUSSOUMA ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, épouses, coépouses, frères et fils dans le village de KOKELE, cercle  de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire le stock, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt et tous les deux prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments, d’oignon, de la restauration  avec AWA et de céréales.
AWA, est la présidente du groupe, arrêtée au début du rang avec un mouchoir verdâtre sur la photo, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100 kilos de riz et 10 paquets de cube maggi avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit dans au bord du goudron à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider le mari à subvenir au dépenses familiales et le reste investi dans les activités.
texts.en:
The group DOUSSOUSSOUMA is composed of four married women averaging 33 years of age and three children each. The women live in traditional extended families with their husbands, wives, and co-wives, brothers, and sons in the village of KOKELE, in Cercle de Bougouni. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. 

To bolster their financial capacity, so as to build a better inventory, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their third loan. The previous two loans were correctly repaid.

This group of women does commerce in condiments, onions, grains, and food service, as is the case with AWA, who is the group's president. She is standing at the end in the photo and wearing a greenish headscarf. She intends to use her loan to purchase 100 kg of rice and 10 packs of Maggi bouillon cubes from wholesalers from Bougouni. She makes her sales at the retail level and accepts cash and sometimes credit at the roadside. Her customer base is composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to help her husband in covering family expenses. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to make meals to sell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est constitué de neuf femmes (huit mariées et une veuve) qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et  5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris,  coépouses, frères et fils. Elles résident dans le quartier NIEBALA de la ville Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des relations de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leurs capacités financières afin de mieux faire leurs commerces, elles adhérent à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales  avec ALIMA, de pagnes, de la restauration, de l’encens, de friperie, de condiments alimentaires, etc.
ALIMA, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la seule arrêtée sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 200 kilogrammes de sorgho avec les paysans producteurs. Elle fait son commerce au marché  au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et utiliser pour aider le conjoint à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The Danaya group consists of nine women (eight of whom are married, and one of whom is widowed). They are an average of 46 years old and have an average of five children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons. They reside in the Niebala quarter of the city of Bougouni (located in the third administrative region of Mali).

The group members know one another through relationships of vicinity, friendship and commerce. In order to strengthen their financial positions and to help their businesses grow, the group is working with the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first loan. The women in this group are involved in several types of commerce, including the sale of grain, second-hand clothing, incense, spices and pagnes (traditional West African cloth), as well as food production and service.

Alima (shown standing in the photo) is a grain merchant and the president of the group. With her portion of the loan, she intends to purchase 200 kilograms of sorghum from local farmers. She sells her goods in cash and on credit at the market. Her clientele is composed of both men and women. Alima expects to make an average monthly income of 20,000 francs CFA. She plans to use her income to reinvest in her business as well as to help pay for her family's living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 200 kilograms of sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa est homme marié de 39 ans et père de 1 enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Monsieur Moussa a abandonné l’école dès son jeune âge. Il a tenté pendant des années différentes activités mais sans succès. Il finit par s’intéresser auprès d’un de ses ami, aux activités d’achat et de vente des intrants, des équipements agricoles et des produits phytosanitaires.
Avec une expérience de plus de 10 ans, il maîtrise son activité dans laquelle il est sollicité et apprécié à Bougouni et environs.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en nombreuses et exigeantes, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après deux prêts tous correctement remboursés, il est à son troisième prêt qui sera utiliser pour acheter, 10 appareils de pulvérisation et 15 bidons d’insecticides. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako, Sikasso et Ouelessebougou auprès des grossistes. Son magasin est situé au bord la route reliant Bougouni à Sikasso. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale et surtout de paysans.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour améliorer son entreprise et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa is a 39-year-old married man and the father of one child. He lives with his wife and child in the Torakabougou district in Bougouni. He dropped out of school at an early age. For some years, he attempted different businesses but without success. A friend finally interested him in the buying and selling of farm inputs, equipment, and pesticides. With over ten years of experience, he has a mastery of his business for which he is much in demand and appreciated in and around Bougouni. 

To satisfy his continuously growing and demanding customer base, Mr. Moussa decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After two loans, both correctly paid back, he is now on his third loan, which will be used to purchase 10 crusher/grinders and 15 containers of insecticides. He gets his supplies from Bamako, Sikasso, and Ouelessebougou from wholesale merchants. His store is located on the road linking Bougouni and Sikasso. His customers are composed of local people and especially peasant farmers. 

He plans on making a monthly profit of 65,000 francs CFA that will be used to improve his enterprise and to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm equipment and insecticides

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Monsieur Daouda est un homme marié de 30 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants à Bougouni, dans le quartier Torakabougou.
Monsieur Daouda est un enseignant de profession, qui mène en plus de cette profession les activités d’achat et de vente de tissus apprises auprès d’un de ses ami commerçant.
Nanti d’une dizaine année d’expérience dans le domaine, il maîtrise bien son activité dans laquelle il est très apprécié et sollicité à Bougouni.
Dans le cadre du renforcement de son activité commerciale, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui il est à son cinquième prêt.et tous les quatre prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. 
Il compte acheter, 20 pièces de tissus auprès des commerçants faisant le voyage du Burkina Faso. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et femmes. Il revend en détail au comptant et à crédit payable mensuellement. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000 FCFA, qui servira à rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
Mr. Daouda is a 30-year-old married man and the father of three children. He lives with his wife and children in Bougouni, in the Torakabougou district. He is a teacher by profession and in addition has a business buying and selling cloth. He learned how from one of his friends in business. Bestowed with a dozen years of experience in this domain, he has a real mastery of his business, in which he is much in demand and appreciated in Bougouni.

With regard to bolstering his business, Mr. Daouda decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. He is now on his fifth loan. The four previous  loans were all paid back without any problems.

He intends to purchase 20 lengths of cloth from merchants who travel to Burkina Faso. His customer base is composed of men and women. He sells retail, accepting cash or credit, payable monthly. 

With this loan, he plans on making a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sell

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Né vers 1975 à Kolondièba, Yaya vit avec ses 3 enfants et sa femme dans une famille traditionnelle à Kolondièba. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, Monsieur  Yaya s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des  céréales mil, riz, maïs, fonio, arachide, niébé, etc.  Il est très apprécié et sollicité à Fakola et environs.  
Nanti de 3 années d’expériences dans le domaine, Yaya dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son  deuxième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé le précédent. 
Yaya compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne de fonio auprès des paysans producteurs  des villages. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant en  détail à Sikasso.
Yaya espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Born around 1975 in Kolondièba, Mr. Yaya lives with his three children and his wife in a traditional family in Kolondièba. Not having had the chance to attend school due to societal reasons, Mr. Yaya quickly became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying and selling of grains: millet, rice, corn, 'fonio', peanuts, black-eyed peas, etc. He is much in demand and appreciated in and around Fakola. 

Bestowed with three years of experience in this domain, Mr. Yaya decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in his search for financial resources. He is now on his second loan after having repaid the previous one correctly.

He intends to use his loan to purchase 2 tonnes of corn and a tonne of 'fonio' from peasant producers from the villages. He makes his sales at the retail level accepting cash or credit in Sikasso. 

Mr. Yaya hopes to make a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs, repay the loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase grains to sell

loans.name: Saibou

texts.fr:
Né vers 1980 à Diomana, Saibou  vit avec ses 5 enfants et leur mère dans une famille traditionnelle, à Diomana. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études, Monsieur Saibou s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment la réparation de bicyclettes, motos  et l’achat vente des pièces détachées de rechanges pour vélo et motos.  Il est très apprécié et sollicité à Diomana et environs.  
Nanti de 5 années d’expériences dans le domaine, Saibou dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt. 
Saibou compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2  grosses caisses de différentes sortes de pièces détachées pour motos auprès des grossistes de Koumantou. Il effectue ses ventes, au comptant en détail et à crédit au marché de Diomana à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Saibou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Born around 1980 in Diomana, Mr. Saibou lives with his five children and their mother in a traditional family in Diomana. Not having had the chance to advance in school, Mr. Saibou quickly became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in repairing bicycles and motorbikes and in the buying and selling of replacement parts for bikes and 'motos'.  He is much in demand and appreciated in and around Diomana. 

Bestowed with five years of experience in this domain, Mr. Saibou decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in his search for financial resources. He is now on his first loan.

He intends to use his loan to purchase 2 large cases of different kinds of spare parts for motorbikes from wholesale merchants in Koumantou. He makes his sales retail, accepting cash or credit at the Diomana market. His customer base is composed of men and women.

Mr. Saibou hopes to make a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs, repay the loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase bike parts to sell

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Composé de femmes mariées, les membres du groupe TIESSIRI  ont en moyenne 43 ans,  4 enfants et  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, épouses, coépouses, frères et fils, dans le quartier Heremakono Centre de la ville Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et d’activités professionnelles. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième prêt et  le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de chaussures, de condiments alimentaires, des articles divers(pâtes dentifrices, cure dents, coton-tige) de tissus avec OUMOU, la présidente du groupe, etc.
OUMOU, assise en tenue rougeâtre derrière une tasse d’articles divers sur les  dans la photo, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 15 pagnes Uniwax avec les grossistes de Bamako pour ensuite les revendre en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans le marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  utilisé pour payer le prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et  investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the TIESSIRI group are married women who are, on average, 43 years old and have four children each. They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, their husbands' wives, co-wives, brothers and sons, in the Heremakono Centre neighborhood of the town of Bougouni.  

These women know each other through neighborhood and friendship ties, and also through their professional activities. They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to strengthen their financial capacity.  This is their second loan with the institution; their previous loan was well repaid.

Oumou, the group's leader, is also the member of the group who sells shoes, condiments, fabrics and various items (toothpaste, tooth-picks, Q-tips).
In the photo, she is the one sitting behind a lot of displayed goods and wearing a reddish outfit.  She plans to use her loan to buy 15 Uniwax "pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics) from wholesalers in Bamako.  She will then resell these pagnes at the Bougouni market or from home, for cash or on credit, to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

Oumou is expecting average monthly profits to reach 20,000 CFA francs.  She will use her profits to repay her loan, cover her family's expenses and reinvest in her activities.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Mamary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamary est un homme marié de 33 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Hérémakono-Nord de Bougouni.
Après les études secondaires sanctionnées par un Diplôme en Comptabilité, il est resté pendant des années sans emploi. 
Il a tenté plusieurs activités notamment la commercialisation de boeufs, de moutons et de chèvres mais sans réussite alors, il décida de s’intéresser aux activités d’achat et de vente de tissus qui lui a réussie.
Avec une expérience de 4 ans il maîtrise son activité qu’il a appris auprès de son ami.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son quatrième prêt et les trois prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Mamary compte acheter, 20 pièces de tissus. Il s’approvisionne en tissus au Burkina et la vente se fait à Bougouni à une clientèle mixte dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt, Mamary compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamary is a 33-year-old married man and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in a traditional family in the Hérémakono-Nord district of Bougouni. After secondary schooling culminating in a degree in accounting, he still had no job for years. He attempted several businesses, especially selling steers, sheep, and goats but unsuccessfully. So he decided to become interested in the buying and selling of cloth, which was successful for him. With four years of experience, he has a mastery of this work, which he learned from a friend. 

Concerned about satisfying his burgeoning customer base, he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is now on his fourth loan. The three previous loans were indeed paid back. 

With this new loan, Mr. Mamary intends to purchase 20 lengths of cloth. He gets his supplies of cloth from Burkina. He makes his sales in Bougouni to a mixed customer base in different districts of Bougouni.

With this loan, he plans on making a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be use to repay the loan and to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sell

loans.name: Miriam Leonor

texts.es:
La Señora Miriam es una socia activa del banco comunal Pauteñitas hace un año y medio, vive por los alrededores del cantón de Paute, lugar que tienen un clima templado propicio para la una gran variedad de frutas y más aun para la floricultura de donde se cosechan las más hermosas flores, su gente es amable y cordial, se dedican a la agricultura, cría de animales y alcomercio.

Doña Miriam tiene 54 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, dos de ellos son casados y viven  independientes, dos  trabajan y  le ayudan económicamente y uno estudia en un colegio del cantón. Su esposo labora en una fábrica de calzado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven  en una casa prestada.

La Señora Miriam se dedica a cuidar una hacienda, en este  lugar vive desde que era una niña y es un trabajo que lo realiza desde generaciones ya que su abuela cuidaba este lugar y después lo realizo su mamá y ahora esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos. También se dedica a la cría de pollos, cuyes y cerdos.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes, cerdos y alimento para animales.

Su meta es comprarse un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Miriam has been an active member of the community bank Pauteñitas [little Paute] for a year and a half. She lives in the outskirts of the canton of Paute, a place that has a mild climate favorable for a great variety of fruits and even more so for growing the most beautiful flowers. The people are friendly and polite, and work in agriculture, raise animals, and do business.  

Doña Miriam is 54 years old and married. As a result of her marriage she has conceived five children who are now adults; two of them are married and live independently, two work and they help her financially, and one studies in the canton's school. Her husband works in a shoe factory. They don't have their own home but live in a borrowed house. 

Señora Miriam works caring for a ranch. She has lived in this place since she was a girl, and it's a job that goes back generations; her grandmother took care of this place, and then her mother did, and now this task is the source of her own income. She also raises chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. 

She is going to invest the funds in the purchase of chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and animal feed. 

Her goal is to buy herself a plot of land to build a house.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and pigs, and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Natif de Koutiala, Monsieur Seydou est âgé de 32 ans,  mariée et père de 3 enfants. Il est polygame et vit chez son père avec ses femmes et ses enfants au quartier  Darsalam II de la ville de Koutiala.  
Il n’a pas fréquenté l’école dû à des raisons sociales, raison pour laquelle il a vite embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père depuis son jeune  âge et l’exerce pour lui-même depuis maintenant 11 ans. 
Son activité lui est rentable et il s’en sort bien, car il reçoit toujours de commandes de particuliers (planteurs) et de structures professionnelles. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, Seydou a fait recours à   l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y’a 2 ans, il est à son 4 eme prêt et les trois précédents ont été remboursés correctement.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte augmenter son stock en provenance du Burkina Faso, en achetant 2.000 plants d’arbres. Seydou effectue ses ventes dans la ville de Koutiala et à la maison, à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et en détail. 
Avec ce financement, il compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 200.000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins, à rembourser son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il ambitionne agrandir son activité en achetant beaucoup plus d’espèces afin d’attirer plus la clientèle.
texts.en:
A native of Koutiala, Mr. Seydou is 32 years old, married, and the father of three children. He is polygamous and lives in his father's house with his wives and children in the Darsalam II district of Koutiala City. He did not attend school due to societal reasons. And so he quickly embraced revenue-generating work at a young age at his father's side. 

Mr. Seydou has now been working on his own for eleven years. His business is profitable. He does well for himself because he always has special orders from individuals (growers) and from professional organizations. 

To satisfy his customers properly, Mr. Seydou turned toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. He is now on his fourth loan. The three previous ones were correctly paid back.

With this new loan, he intends to increase his inventory by purchasing 2,000 tree seedlings from Burkina Faso. He makes his sales retail in Koutiala City and at the house, and he accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of men and women. 
  
With this financing, he is planning on a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will enable him to meet his needs and repay the loan. The rest will be invested in his business. His ambition is to expand his business by purchasing many more types of seedlings in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase tree seedlings

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Agée de 45 ans, Rokia vit avec ses  3  enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire à Kolondièba,  un chef lieu d’une commune rurale. 
Maîtresse d’école coranique, Rokia s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente beurre de karité, d’habillements et de pagnes wax. Elle est très appréciée et sollicitée à Kolondièba et environs
Rokia est à son cinquième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter 5 tonnes de beurre de karité avec les villageois, 5 pièces de pagnes wax de différentes qualités auprès des grossistes de Kolondièba et de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes, au comptant à une société Sénégal. 
Rokia espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Rokia, aged 45, lives with her three children and her husband in a nuclear family in Kolondièba, the main town of a Commune Rurale. She is a teacher at a Koranic school. Rokia soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying and selling of shea butter, clothing, and 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She is much in demand and appreciated in and around Kolondièba. 

Rokia is on her fifth loan, which will be used to purchase 5 tonnes of shea butter from villagers and 5 lengths of wax 'pagne' cloth of different qualities from wholesale merchants in Kolondièba and in Bamako. She makes her sales  in cash to a private company in Senegal. 

Rokia hopes to make a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to help her husband cover family expenses, to repay the loan, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase shea butter and 'pagne' cloth to sell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, les 6 membres du groupe  Danaya  vivent dans des familles polygames  avec en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le cercle de Kolondièba et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente des articles divers  tels les céréales, les pagnes, les condiments alimentaires etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 2 ème prêt solidaire.
Sitan,  qui est la femme assise et la présidente du groupe, fait l’achat  vente de céréales et des condiments alimentaires. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  5 colis de différentes sortes de condiments alimentaires et 2 sacs d’ignames de 100 kilogrammes  auprès des revendeurs du marché de Kolondièba. La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame Sitan espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge  certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Exclusively married women, the six members of the group Danaya lives in polygamous families, and they average 33 years of age and three children each all living in Cercle de Kolondièba. The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, and marriage. And they buy and sell various goods, such as grains, 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), condiments, etc. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Sitan, seated in the photo, is the group's president. She trades in grains and condiments. She intends to use her loan to purchase 5 packs of various types of condiments and two 100-kg sacks of yams from retailers at the Kolondièba market. Cash or credit sales are made to a customer base composed of men and women. 

With this loan, Ms. Sitan hopes to make an average monthly profit of 12,500 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business and used to meet certain household needs.

loans.use: to purchase food provisions to sell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les huit femmes du groupe  DANAYA  ont  en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Cinzara dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font essentiellement l’achat et la vente de laits sous toutes ses formes et des tissus. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 2ème prêt solidaire.
Madame Aya (1ère assise de la droite vers la gauche)  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes fancy auprès des boutiquiers de San. Elle vend au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à Cinzara et dans d’autres foires. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame  Aya  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The eight women who compose the DANAYA group are all married in extended traditional families.  They are, on average, 38 years old and have four children each. They all live in the village of Cinzara, in the Segou region (fourth administrative region of Mali), and they know each other through neighborhood, marriage or family ties.  They are essentially involved in buying and selling milk in its different forms, and also fabrics.

In order to boost their businesses, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their second solidarity loan.

Aya (first from the right in the front row) is planning to use her loan to buy 10 pieces of "Fancy print" pagnes (African printed wax cloth) from shopkeepers in the town of San.  She sells for cash or on credit to a retail group of customers consisting of men and women.  She sells her goods in Cinzara and other markets.

Aya is expecting average monthly profits to reach 40,000 CFA francs. She will use her profits to reinvest in her activity and to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy some pagnes.

loans.name: Tièssiri 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 30 ans et 2 enfants, les sept membres du groupe Tièssiri 2 vivent toutes dans le village de Siradjankoro dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but d’utiliser la main d’œuvre masculine pour réaliser le labour et les travaux d’entretien, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil, le gombo, le fonio et le niébé.
Madame Fatoumata Daouda (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs d’urée, des semences d’arachides  et recruter la main d’œuvre pour effectuer le labour et le désherbage de ses champs. Elle se ravitaille en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes  et en intrants agricoles au grand marché de Ségou. Avec une superficie de 3 hectares, elle espère produire, 10 sacs d’arachide, 4 sacs de mil, un sac de niébé et des fanes.  Une partie de la production est auto consommée tandis que le reste et les fanes de niébé sont vendus pour gérer les besoins du foyer en condiments et entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
For the most part married women in large traditional families and averaging 30 years of age and two children each, the seven members of the group Tièssiri 2 all live in the village of Siradjankoro, in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, marriage, and community. 

With the goal of utilizing male labor for carrying out the upkeep work, they turned toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second farm loan cycle. The group members are going to grow peanuts, millet, okra, 'fonio', and black-eyed peas.  

Ms. Fatoumata Daouda (the woman standing at the far left in the photo) intends to use her loan to purchase 2 sacks of urea and some peanut seeds and to recruit labor for carrying out the plowing and weeding on her fields. She supplies herself with labor from the association of young people, and as for the farm inputs, from the big market of Ségou.  

With a land area of 3 hectares, she hopes to produce 10 sacks of peanuts, 4 sacks of millet, a sack of black-eyed peas, and some fodder. Part of the produce will be consumed at home, while the rest, plus the black-eyed peas fodder, are sold to manage the needs of the household in terms of food and childcare.

loans.use: to purchase urea and the seeds for planting peanuts, millet, and black-eyed peas, and to utilize male labor for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Djidja Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les cinq femmes du groupe   DJIDJA  ont  en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Cinzara dans le Cercle de San  région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente d’ustensiles, de condiments, de céréales, etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe  intègrent Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er prêt solidaire.
Madame Saran  (assise avec une écharpe blanche sur la tête)  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des ustensiles de cuisine en plastiques auprès des grossistes du marché de San. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married in extended traditional families, the five women who compose the DJIDJA group are, on average, 39 years old and have three children each. They all live in the village of Cinzara, in the Cercle of San, Segou region (fourth administrative region of Mali), and they know each other through neighborhood, marriage or family ties. They buy and sell utensils, condiments, grains etc. 

In order to boost their businesses, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their first solidarity loan.

Saran (sitting, with a white shawl wrapped around her head) is planning to use her loan to buy plastic kitchen utensils from wholesalers at the market of San. She sells for cash or on credit to a retail group of customers consisting of men and women. 

She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 25,000 CFA francs. She will use her profits to reinvest in her activity and to meet some of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy plastic kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe  BEN ont  en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Tamaro dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de légumes, de condiments alimentaires, etc. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe décident  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er  prêt solidaire.
